Reviews.Title: “Not the best Travelodge (in some rooms)”
Reviews.Author: vicky f
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Travelodges in London city centre and I believe this is the most hit and miss hotel. When I visited in April 2011, I stayed in a large beautiful room which impressed both me and my friend. However, after booking a stay in February, I became a little unsure of the hotel. We were greeted at the desk by a very helpful gentleman named Vitor (who became our saviour throughout the trip) and given our keycard. As we entered our double room, we realised that perhaps part of the hotel had been renovated, and this was one of the older rooms. In my friend's opinion, it resembled "a cave". With old brickwork, a tiny bathroom and overall, a small room, we decided to ask if we were able to change room. Unfortunately, the hotel was fully booked and we were told if we wanted to change for our second night, we would be able to. Although we felt like we were creating a hassle by asking this, Vitor seemed to know where we were coming from and instantly made a note for the next member of staff on shift that we were wanting to change rooms. The next day, we returned to the desk to ask if we were able to change rooms and were presented with another key card for a room which was much nicer than the previous. The hotel is in a rather good area if you are travelling to and from Kings Cross or are needing to be in that specific area. If you are wanting to be in the city centre, where you'd like the ability to walk everywhere, perhaps Covent Garden Travelodge is more suited for you. There are buses and tubes run from near the hotel though, so if you're okay with travelling then this hotel is okay.

Reviews.Title: “Run down hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rick D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is desperately in need of full renovation. The quality and comfort of the rooms was on a par with a private room in a youth hostel, although admittedly you do get an en suite. Room was also very cold, and noisy from the street outside and trains rumbling by. The other clientele in the hotel reflected the sort of people you would expect to be hanging around in a cheap, run down and anonymous hotel round the corner from Kings Cross. Barely met our requirements.

Reviews.Title: “The worse Travelodge I've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: UsernameNotFound
Reviews.Content: As I've stayed in a fair few Travelodge's before, I wasn't expecting much. Just a clean bed and bathroom. I only, however, got half of this. The bed was lovely and comfortable, no complaints there at all. It was the bathroom that I was disappointed with. For once, it was nice to have an actual bath instead of just a shower, but the condition of the bath wasn't great. There were holes in the bath that had clearly been poorly filled in - it was something you would do at home, not something you'd expect when staying in Central London, even if it was cheap. Also, the carpet was all frayed at the edges and poorly fitted. There was also a light in the room that wouldn't stop flickering, and eventually went out. However, the bulb was changed the next day, so really no complaints. Other than that it was alright. But the little things really do matter. What made it worse was that it was a fifteen minute walk to King's Cross Station (which is the nearest tube station, not Farringdon station as first thought) and that we passed another TWO Travelodge's to get to it. Another thing that made it worse was that there was a Holiday Inn exactly opposite where we were staying! Disappointed with this Travelodge, and will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: insulaner1984
Reviews.Content: stayed here privately as I needed to catch the first Eurostar in the morning (good: 10-15mins walk to St. Pancras). Payed very little. Got what I paid for - staff was nice enough, they even allowed me to help myself to some breakfast, even though it was 4am and the breakfast room not yet prepared. If I would have known what Travelodge breakfast means, i would have given it a miss... but that's not the staff's fault. room was incredibly tired. was woken up a number of times by naked teens running across the corridor, and one mistakingly (?!) knocking at my door (multiple school classes seemed to use this hotel as their base in London). Didn't get a lot of sleep. The lift could be heard moving up and down even though I was a fair few rooms away from it. Possibly would have enjoyed this place more if not travelling alone but as a crashover place on a road trip or so, but needing to get up at 4am my mood was not helped by how little sleep I managed to get. If you are on the budget this may be your choice, but come with zero expectations and hopefully no early start in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for The West End”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times. We have always had a clean, plain room with a good shower. Have always stayed in winter and rooms have always been warm. Quieter rooms are at the rear or in the building next door. Staff very helpful and breakfast (all U can eat) extremely good value. A five minute walk up to Rosebery Avenue gets you to the stop for number 38 bus which goes every few minutes to Cambridge Circus (for theatres), Piccadilly Circus, Hyde Park Corner. It passes Buckingham Palace and ends its journey at Victoria Bus Station just outside Victoria Train Station. A cheap, clean basic hotel which is surprisingly well located.

Reviews.Title: “bargain stay - had all the basics”
Reviews.Author: Nozzer_on_tour
Reviews.Content: OK, you want to stay in Londo n for a few days - you want to see the sights, what do you need?? a bed, a bath, a comfy bed and a bit of TV. well we stayed at the Faringdon travelodge up the road from Kings cross. Rooms are basic, but had a TV with freeview, plenty of room, clean, ensuite, kettle and coffee. On site restaurant served a good breakfast and my parents had dinner in the restaurant and it was very good. Staff very very helpful - nothing was too much trouble and this made it all good. yes the rooms are a bit tired and the double glazing could be better, the hotel is on the main road, and at the back is the railway line, but not many rooms look onto the railway. Luckily we read that - so took ear plugs, so no worries. It is quite a walk from Kings cross, but you can catch the 63 bus, straight outside of Kings cross, and it drops you off right outside. The pub next door but one does an excellent tea - 2 courses for Â£10 before 7.00. if you can't be bothered to go back into London. Definately be going back as good value for money

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimcarlisle8
Reviews.Content: Rooms are reasonable for the location and price. Ideal for a budget stay though quite noisy road outside, worth requesting a room at the back of hotel, breakfast was good with choice of hot and cold buffet

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but very tired and tatty...”
Reviews.Author: elwheelio
Reviews.Content: Not your standard travelodge room and fit-out. If you can get a cheap deal then it's worth investigating for the good location. However, this place is in need of serious tlc.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TanyaBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at this hotel. Room was basic but clean and the bed was comfy. Wish there had been way of turning heating down though, as it was too warm. We had breakfast but would not do so next time we stayed at a travelodge. The staff were pleasant and helpful. I would say that the hotel is further than the 1/5 mile that were on our directions. It is about 10 - 15 mins away from the nearest tube station, Kings Cross.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value with a central location”
Reviews.Author: Kathmacp
Reviews.Content: Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Excellent location. Excellent breakfast. Rooms could do with a lick of paint. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Dismal !!!”
Reviews.Author: ziggy01
Reviews.Content: First the good point. It's in a good spot near some good eateries and not touristy. Unfortunately I have not got any good points. Staff never on the reception desk, always in the back office. The triple room was tiny and very noisy (we had asked for a quiet room), the bathroom was probably the same size as in a tourer caravan and really need a good clean and updating. The tiles around the bath were grubby and the grouting was black in some areas. The pillows were next to useless. Half the draws were broken and one plug was dangerous. We had 2 towels between three of us. I could go on! What I would say is considering we are hosting the Olympics this year and will have visitors from around the world, I would have thought that Travelodge would have invested money on an upgrade. Sadly they have not and I do hope that people DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Worth Â£12. No more.”
Reviews.Author: rubyhatespets
Reviews.Content: I paid Â£12 for a double room in the Travelodge sale and if I had paid full price I would be gutted. At the time of booking I thought I had managed to bag an amazing bargain, but now I think the price I paid was about right. The room was adequate but unwelcoming and shabby. On the plus side the bedding was clean and there was plentiful hot water. The bathroom was dated but generally clean, although the toilet bowl was cracked and the hooks on the back of the door were broken. The room was very small with the double bed pushed right up against the wall on two sides. The mattress was very soft and there was a fag-burn on the duvet. The pillows were wafer thin and when we asked for more we were told there weren't any. The lighting was peculiar; it was all-or-nothing so any hopes of reading in bed evaporated. The remote control for the TV didn't work. The traffic noise, even with double glazing, was very loud. The location of the hotel was absolutely fine for the price. Kings Cross is only a short walk away, or about Â£6 in a taxi if you have a lot of bags, and the walk felt safe. There aren't many restaurants in the immediate vicinity but, as you're in central London, you would have to be severely lacking in imagination not to be able to find somewhere. Overall, it is clear that this hotel is a relatively recent acquisition and is certainly not up to the usual Travelodge standard. I was quite surprised that Travelodge seem happy to put their name to this hotel as it has certainly undermined my confidence in the brand.

Reviews.Title: “Theatre Stop Over”
Reviews.Author: DangerMouse1962
Reviews.Content: This is a good basis clean stop over for somewhere to stay when visiting theatreland in London. The room was adequate, clean bedding and tea/coffee. Plenty of hot water, bath and shower. Our room was at the back of the hotel so can't comment on the noise from main road. We ate here in the evening, food was pretty basic but no problems, even though it was a busy Saturday evening, service was good. Taxis' responsibly priced from here to the main theatres. Breakfast was good - all you can eat! Cereals, yogurt, hot breakfast, plenty of tea and coffee. Would stay again. 11am check-out was good following night out :)

Reviews.Title: “No sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Barry F
Reviews.Content: on first impressions it didn't look too bad a bit run down, but clean. on the night time we setteled in after a trip to see Phantom of the opera, only to be kept awake from the annoying generator buzzing constantly and the knocking, dripping noise from the antique central heating system.we moved rooms at 1:30 only to be awoken from the constant baging of the lift. My wife complained in the morning and the staff rolled over with no fuss and issued a full refund, obviously thjis is a regular occurance. Needless to say we will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A total dump”
Reviews.Author: trigger76
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The room was noisy as the double glazing didn't work. The heating was also broken. We reported it and when we returned later they left a small fan heater on the room because they couldn't fix it. The room and the halls smelt musty. The walls in the halls we also covered in cracks and the plaster was coming off. Don't stay here. If u r on a budget go to an easy hotel or if u have more cash go anywhere but here.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and has all the basics”
Reviews.Author: Stuart-Waite
Reviews.Content: Went down to london for one night to see a theatre show. At first glance doesnt look great but for the price you paid (for me i think it was around Â£40-50 for one night) you cant moan. Its clean, tidy and has all the basic stuff like TV, Kettle etc. Bathroom was clean, and we could still get in after 10 even though people are moaning that they couldnt. Staff were friendly and i had nothing to moan about. Basic bog standered hotel for a bog standered price.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Travelodge, but not as we know it, Jim!”
Reviews.Author: Millimole
Reviews.Content: This large hotel has been bought by Travelodge, completely rebranded and run as a Travelodge. But there has been very little investment in the fabric of the building which is now showing signs of the age of the building (late 1970's I'd guess). The location is a bit out of the way - it's not particulalry close to tube stations, and there's only the 63 bus running past. The nearest 'landmark' is the Mount Pleasant Sorting Office. We used taxi's as my partner is unable to walk any distance at the moment (about Â£10 to the Strand). This Travelodge - unusually - has a bar which serves food as well. The bar is spacious, and the food better than I expected, the drinks fairly priced. Our room on the third floor at the back, was bigger than an average Travelodge room, with a comfortable king size bed (but only 1 thin pillow each). It was warm but not too hot, the window opened - but with an idiot strap to prevent it opening properly. There is no air-conditioning, no hair dryer, but there is a kettle and a TV. The room was superficially clean, but was in need of a 'deep clean' in the corners, and around the shower head etc. It wasn't too noisy - considering this is central London, a bit of noise from the car park, and the bins, but nothing too intolerable. You will probably be staying here on a budget - and if you think of this as a cheap hotel you won't have anything to complain about. If you get a Traveloge special deal - you could be very happy at the price for this London hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Victoria R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night following the special prices that travelodge were offering. We paid Â£25 for the night. The room was on the fourth floor and was clean, spacious and had the amenities needed. The room had tea, coffee making facilities, clothes hanging space, clean bathroom, soap, very hot water. The room was lovely and warm which was needed as it was freezing outside. There was a TV but no remote control, we did ask for a remote but one was never delivered. Also there was only two very thin pillows but we asked for more at reception and they provided more. The location is very good and easy to walk to the nearest tube stop, bus stop or local amenities. The hotel is on a main road, but a quiet one - we heard no road noise at all, only the bin wagons emptying the bins at 8am and noise from other guests in the corridor. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Getting worse - unfortunately”
Reviews.Author: Cran4
Reviews.Content: I stay here twice a year for the past few years and whilst it remains one of the cheapest places to stay (especially if you get one of the offers) it is now in dire need of work. Improvements this time were both lifts worked - apart from that the issues were:- - Window seal had gone, so noise from outside was intrusive at all hours - and London is noisy. - Light fittings hanging off the wall - Bed was more like a trampoline - General decor - it really needs work Don't get me wrong, with the cheap deals this is still a reasonable place to stay due to its location, but it certainly wasn't the best place for a weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Desperately needs a makeover! We won't be returning!”
Reviews.Author: gemma0369
Reviews.Content: Have to agree with many of the previous reviewers on this travelodge... we definitely won't be returning! This hotel does not meet up to the usual 'basic, but still clean and pleasant' trademark of other travelodges. Location isn't too bad, but be cautious - it's about a 10-15 minute brisk walk from Kings Cross St Pancras (20-25 minute brisk walk from Euston). So if you're travelling alone you may wish to stay somewhere a little closer to an underground/train station or take a taxi. There are travelodges in much better locations! The rooms were old, tired and generally very tatty. We've stayed in better two stars hotels! The bed linen and towels were clean, but the walls needed freshening up, plaster was peeling away, the room decor was from the 60s/70s I think, the furniture looked ready for a skip. The 'double' bed was also two twins pushed together - which we wouldn't mind if it still functioned as a double (as in other travelodges!)...but it didn't! It was very much two twin beds. The bathroom was also very old and run-down. Perhaps the biggest negative was the shower as we couldn't get water of a useable temperature out of it - I kid you not...it was either water that felt like it had come from a frozen lake or out of a boiling kettle!!...no matter what time of day we tried it! We had to resort to hand washing as the water temperature was useless! Breakfast was a disappointment too. You usually know what to expect - basic but ok. When we managed to get a table it was filthy. The cutlery trays were empty and the hot food wasn't replenished readily enough. Overall a bismal experience to be honest. On a positive note, we couldn't fault the staff - we received a friendly welcome on arrival (and checkout) at reception, and staff were generally pleasant. However, we were questioned on checkout though as to how we rated our stay and interrogated when we said we felt let down and disappointed. We like the travelodge chain...we stay in a lot of them...but we won't be returning to this one! We got this at Â£30 for the night - what would usually be deemed a bargain...but we felt like we'd overpaid to be honest! You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “As expected for the brand, maybe a little nicer than expected for the 25 pound price!”
Reviews.Author: dgrbleu2
Reviews.Content: Second of three different Travelodge hotels I have stayed in since early December. Hotel is in terribly need of a total facelift. 1970's furniture, threadbare carpets. Bathroom very tiny, and took me 10 minutes to figure out the old school shower knobs, but eventually it did produce hot water. I really could not have expected more for the rock bottom price. I slept quite well in the bed, fortunately it had been updated sometime in the past several years! I did, however, partake of the cooked breakfast and will certainly skip that next time and try the little Eurocafe next door. The quality of the food at breakfast was not comparable to a Premier Inn, although the charge was the same. The dining room also was dark and dingy, not pleasant at all. The room was reasonably clean and the hotel was suitable for the one night I spent in it. I was in one of the back staircase rooms, up two floors in a lift, then down a flight of stairs. Could be creepy if I had run into anyone on my way to or from my room... (I believe I was in room 251 or so) The hotel is directly across the street from the Holiday Inn Kings Cross- Bloomsbury, so makes a cheap alternative if you are attending something at that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & cheerful.....well cheap anyway”
Reviews.Author: PatRCheshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last Saturday and while I agree with the other reviews saying the Farrindon is tired and in need of a refurb, I can't really fault the hotel for very good value for money. We paid Â£46 for the night. The room was clean, the bed comfy and we weren't intending spending much time in there. The location was good, in easy walking distance of Kings Cross and the undergound. We were on the first floor facing the road so I was worried about traffic noise but there seemed very little. The only noise we did have was the door in the corridor, the closer was a bit strong and the clunk that we hardly noticed in the day did seem to echo in the night, didn't spoil our stay though. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pay more and stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: BrawLass51
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Our room was old with horrible artex plaster on the walls. I did not like the area and did not feel safe in the hotel. We had to go along a series of corridors and back staircases to get to the room, a very indirect route. The restaurant was not nice, it had a grubby feel and carpet on the floor was stained. In future, I would always pay more and hopefully get somewhere better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Hot, Noisy,Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Jar1
Reviews.Content: I stay at various Travelodges at least once a week so I know what to expect namely great value often very central hotels. This is however not one of their best. Firstly it is in a not very nice area and about 3 bus stops from Farringdon? I know London really well but even though this is near some fantastic areas they are just too far away to walk in the dark and there is next to nothing near to the hotel. Most rooms face a main road and the windows do little to keep out the very loud traffic. It was akin to sleeping in the middle of a roundabout.The room was so hot even though I turned the heating off. I stayed mid January but had to use the fan on full power to cool down and drown out the traffic noise. It does have a bar which is much appreciated as mentioned above there is nothing nearby. The food is cheap but nasty. I will never book this Travelodge again, There are so many better ones in London so choose this as the very last option.

Reviews.Title: “It is a very tired hotel and if you got pet Allergies DON"T stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Zeenit
Reviews.Content: This Hotel's location is good BUT its a very tired hotel and the bed is lumpy. The lamp shades are all burnt. We were woken by a false fire alarm. I am very allergic to Cat hair and discovered to my horror that you can bring all types of pets to stay.This was not explained on their website. They should reburb and then it will be good.

Reviews.Title: “Sad room and sad guest”
Reviews.Author: speedyjoe
Reviews.Content: Tired, depressing decor and facilities. Room 220 overlooked Farringdon Road so very noisy-the Royal Mail sorting office is on the same road so I assume it was the noise of delivery vans that woke me very early every morning. Downsides Grubby TV remote, burn marks on the dressing table, no hairdryer ( you have to go down to reception and request one, then return it asap), inadequate shower, soap not replaced after day 1, bed dreadful, pillows very thin, someone shouting in the corridor at night, no phone in the bedroom to ring reception ( worrying if you are a lone traveller), grubby carpet. Upside Three nights cost Â£75 in the 'sale'.

Reviews.Title: “LET DOWN”
Reviews.Author: LovelyLG
Reviews.Content: Ok so it was Â£40 for the night which yes is cheap and was only wanting somewhere clean to put my head down for the night. Well yes it was reasonably clean but the room and in particular the bathroom was soooo tatty and run down it made the place look dirty. Trecking around London meant i really needed a good nights sleep and thats pretty impossible when the bed rattles, squeaks and bounces like a trampoline everytime you move! It was severley sunken in the middle and the pillows were like 2 flannels. The place needs some money spent. I work in a 4 star hotel so i know the differences to expect but i think above all the bed needs to serve its purpose and when you can't sleep because its so awful someone needs to put their hand in their pocket! Oh and the shower was less a shower and more a trickle that smelt of drains! Have low low expectations and you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Served its Purpose!”
Reviews.Author: Chloe K
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the awful reviews of this hotel, I was very worried about where we would be staying - however I was pleasantly surprised. After making our booking online in the Travelodge sale we then decided that we would stay any extra night (meaning 2 bookings made online) When we arrived I asked the receptionist if he would be able to merge our bookings to save us checking out and in on the same day and he was only too happy to help. The car park to the rear of the hotel is Â£15 for 24 hours however it does only take change but I was able to pay for the car park over the phone using my card. We had a single room on the second floor and a double room on the fourth floor and both were clean and tidy but most of all very warm!!! I agree that the rooms do need updating and some of the beds need replacing but if you only pay Â£12-Â£15 a night then this is a bargain price considering its location (half hour walk to Covent Garden). We didnt have the breakfast at the hotel and so glad as there is a lovely cafe (Maya Cafe) 2 minutes down the road who serve a lovely full english and a variety of other versions for those who maybe cant eat all that first thing. So polite and helpful, very reasonably priced and not too greasy! Recommend this hotel if you can get it in the sale and do not be put off by the bad reviews. If all you are looking for is a warm place to lay your head then stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - Cleanliness was an issue”
Reviews.Author: ryan1469
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night. As far as Travelodge's go, it's got to be one of the worst! I've stayed in loads and I'd say this ranks bottom of them all. Service was poor and staff seemed overworked. Despite this, check-in was swift and easy. The corridors were really narrow and rooms tired. Had to change rooms as the shower didn't work in the first room. Second room was much of the same, tired and cramped. Despite this, if you're only using this hotel as a base, as I was, it's adequate. It's not the cleanest, it's not the most pleasant, but it's OK!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a budget price”
Reviews.Author: Beckiboo1983
Reviews.Content: I paid Â£20 for my room through one of Travelodge's saver deals. Our room was 302 which was at the back overlooking the carpark. It was absolutely fine for the money I paid. Clean and basic, and most importantly, quiet! The bed was comfortable and I had a good nights sleep here. Coffee and tea facilities in the morning and a hot shower. Yes the furnishings were quite old, but I didn't expect a bran new room for the price I paid, all I wanted was a clean room, comfy bed and a good night's sleep. This ticked all my boxes. I'm unsure whether I would pay full price (Â£60-80) for the rooms here, but at sale price this was a good deal. One other thing - we used automatic check-in upon arrival. A machine looking a bit like an ATM takes your creditcard, or your reservation number and automatically checks you in and allocates you a room card. This probably took all of 30secs to do and was so easy to use! Saved having to wait and reception for someone and we zoomed straight up to our room. In the morning we gave our card in, brief check out questions with the receptionist and off we went. No problems here.

Reviews.Title: “I suppose you get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: richierich1984
Reviews.Content: Â£25 for a night in london...bargain! I would have preferred to pay more for a location closer to a tube station. Aside from the long walk to a tube, the room was grubby and very dated, lots of stains on the carpet, dirty bathroom...and very uncomfortable beds. We did not see one member of staff during our stay as check in and out were self service. It was a barhain.however be prepared!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: HerefordEater
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room on the second floor facing the back of the hotel. The room was very noisy and on our second night we enjoyed the banging music until two in the morning. Not ! The rooms are very dated and it is need of a refit. The bathroom was clean but again not very modern. The plug didn't fit the bath. On the second morning we wondered why our clothes that we had taken off and left on the floor we were wet. The radiator had been leaking. The side of the bed was wet along with the carpet. Thank the lord we were leaving. The staff were helpful with a iorn and ironing board, yet we had a unwelcoming check in. The corridors and other areas were clean but the hotel is tired. The location is great. I think the price should be reduced by Â£15 a night to reflect the standard of the hotel. There is also only one lift working. I hope who is in charge of travel lodges has this one on the list next for a refit.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: sptsilva
Reviews.Content: Definitely, not as bad as some reviews here. The room is not perfect, but is good enough to stay for some days while visiting London. Don't forget to choose a room either on the back of the hotel or on the floor 4 or 5, otherwise it can be too noisy. There is not much variety for the breakfast but is OK. The location is very central and you can be at Kings Cross in less than 5 minutes by bus (63) or about 15 minutes walking. What I found unacceptable was that, during my four days stay, there was only one lift in operation which caused some delays specially in the morning when the maids were trying to make the rooms and guests to have breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - not half as bad as expected”
Reviews.Author: tjniloc
Reviews.Content: I always states that any review I give will be honest and factual. This is also the same. After reading previous reviews I was a little anxious as to what I should expect, many poor review, other asking for rooms at rear so they were quiet etc etc. I stayed 2 nights. The hotel is a 5 min walk away from Kings Cross station past 2 other Travelodge hotels. On check in I asked ro a quiet roomm at the rear. I was given room 222 and when I located it I found it to be on the main road. The room was clean enough and whilst it is not 5 star I certainly did not pay 5 star prices. It had plenty of hot water, the TV was fine with Tea/Coffee facilities in the room. My small grip was that my "double" bed was 2 singles pushed together but no real problem. The staff were fine and attentive to my needs, Breakfast was Ok, nothing out of the ordinary but quite acceptable and guess what - the room was even quiet. I would stay here again if I had the same room rates so look logically and if you feel the price is right and you are not expecting 5 star than stay there, really its fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good for money”
Reviews.Author: Michaellaw123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and included breakfast. Hotel is a 5 min walk from kings cross stations and is about 200 meters farther away from station than another travelodge hotel royal scott. Have now stayed at both royal scott and farringdon and i must say the farringdon is much better. The receptionist was very helpful and suggested a change of room for us. Most staff are a lttle layed back but it was acceptable. The breakfast was well worth having and the rooms adequate. Would consider staying again as a good price and being in kings cross is a Zone one area of London transport.

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as bad as some reviews suggest!”
Reviews.Author: SiannyBee
Reviews.Content: I feel compelled to write a review of this hotel to counter some of the negative reviews that have come before. This is a Travelodge. In Central London. It cost me Â£59 on a flexible (cancellable) rate. You are not going to find a 4 star hotel at this price in this location. Ever. This hotel was perfect for what we needed: a place to crash after a Christmas party. We checked in on a Friday afternoon about half an hour before the official check-in time and at no extra cost. The staff were friendly and helpful. We were given Room 122 (first floor at the front of the building direclty opposite the lifts) which was clean. The bathroom was minuscule but I wasn't planning a night in with a relaxing bath so this wasn't a problem. We spent most of our time out so the room itself wasn't important. More important to me is the location; because of where the hotel is situated we were able to walk to and from everywhere we needed to get to including Clerkenwell, Russell Square, St Pancras and Euston. We were very late back so I don't know what night time noise was like but from about 8am I started to hear the lift noise and people talking outside the room but that's to be expected with a room directly opposite the lift. The traffic noise didn't bother me too much, neither did the slight rumbling from the tube. It's central London - what do you expect? I'm still utterly perplexed about why they only provide three pillows in a double room but you can ask for more if you need them! I was dreading staying in this hotel after reading the reviews. I needn't have worried. It was clean, cheap, central and the staff were friendly. I wouldn't recommend it for more than a night or two and certainly not for a romantic trip away but if it's a bed for the night you need, you could do a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “Thank god I don't have to go back”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLight21
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay in London following the 'works christmas do'. The reception staff were friendly enough. The actual rooms were horrible. This is probably the worst hotel I've stayed in ever. The rooms are dated, and battered - they've seen better days maybe in the 1970's. The walls and ceilings are all heavily artexed and so have captured all the dust and dirt of the last forty years. The hotel kindly supplied some soap, which was the size of an After Eight Mint. The TV didn't work at first, there was no remote control in the room. My husband went to get a remote and an ironing and ironing board, which arrived via the porter about 45 mins later. The remote only turned the tv on, the rest of the controls didn't work. The TV had serious echo on it. The iron leaked water even when it was supposed to be set at steam. The window didn't lock properly which since it was on the 4th floor wasn't a security problem but it was cold being December. My husband (free of charge to the hotel) fixed their dodgy window, mainly to prevent me jumping out of it in a fit of depression. The curtains were filthy. The bathrooms are nasty, the taps are in serious need of descaling. In fact I'd recommend a complete rip out and refit. The noise in the corridoors was ridiculous between 3am and 6am. Any business travellers considering this hotel should give it a wide berth and go somewhere else. Its too noisy. The bed wasn't all that comfortable and considering the rest of the issues, had it been 'sleepable' I may have overlooked the rest, but it wasn't. Dear Mr. Travel Lodge Chairman, you seriously need to refurb this hotel. It has the potential to be a gem sadly its nothing more than a lump of coal. Next time I'll pay the extra and stay at the Holiday Inn over the road.

Reviews.Title: “Wallet friendly central London bed”
Reviews.Author: RoseThistleLady
Reviews.Content: I had a midweek one night stay due to a works Christmas party. The location was great for travelling to work next day, but the main road directly outside is busy all night, so though the beds were comfortable my sleep was disturbed. With three girls sharing it was a bargain at Â£23 each. The room was decent sized, the decor slightly worn but clean. The bathroom was slightly cramped, but adequately stocked, and the shower worked well. I've been in better decorated Travelodge's in quieter areas, but this was just the ticket with regards to location and budget.

Reviews.Title: “It's a budget hotel chain so don't expect anything special.”
Reviews.Author: Huckatola
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had separate Christmas parties in London so chose to stay in the City rather than have the hassle of travelling home. At Â£19.50 for the double room, this was a absolute steal. Even the guy at reception was shocked at the price (booked during one of the Travelodge promotional deals) as he said the walk-in price would be close to Â£200, which is frankly a joke (in my view). The room was clean, relatively spacious and had the benefit of small TV. For the price, there was nothing to fault. If you pay up-to ca.Â£60-80 then this is a good option. Any more and you will start to feel that there were better options you could have chosen.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly reasonable option for the price”
Reviews.Author: aber_james
Reviews.Content: This Travelodge offered the lowest priced room for central(ish) London for my trip last weekend. It is indeed a budget hotel, and the facilities are basic. But at least it was clean, tea/coffee in the room etc. Staff were friendly. The hotel is only 10 minutes walk from King's Cross, and also on the #63 bus route. The shower was a bit of a climb in and out so this may be worth checking if you are at all infirm.

Reviews.Title: “Be realistic and you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: PippinCat
Reviews.Content: The reviews of the Travelodge London Farringdon were pretty dismal but I booked three nights anyway: it was cheap, close to King's Cross Station, could accommodate three adults in the one room with its own facilities, and - basically - it was cheap. Three nights for GBP210 was by far the best deal, and we arrived without pre-conceptions. The room was bright, warm, the bathroom was clean and - best of all - the shower was hot and strong, and the towels were crisply clean, white and huge! The downside: the heater couldn't be adjusted and the room got very warm even with the window open; there were cracked (and repaired) tiles and the toilet bowl was cracked (but clean); the decor was textured-paint walls; pub-carpet; and 80s-style timber panelling. No remote, we had to stand on a chair to change channels or switch it off (the wall control panel didn't work despite Omar insisting it did - we aren't THAT dumb, guys); and our room overlooked the entry where cabbies stood and smoked and argued (not what I wanted to hear at 6.30am). The doors are thin - we were woken at 2am by a neighbouring couple having a loud argument: not the fault of staff (who did apologise anyway). Keiran was especially helpful, seeming to be an all-rounder counter staff, bar man, waiter, and all-round nice helpful guy. It was clean, convenient, and cheap: you get what you pay for so go in with your eyes open. If you want four-star decor you will pay for it. This hotel will be made-over soon, probably become a Premier Inn, and you'll be paying a heap more. Be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: LittlePiskie
Reviews.Content: Trevelodge: Basic. Clean. Comfy bed. Well served food and a pint in the bar on site. Had a ground floor room and could hear the tubes rumbling which wasn't a problem for a country bumpkin in the city but might annoy some people. Breakfast was average, nothing wrong with it, self service buffet including cooked breakfast. Staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Can't even get basic room security right - twice!”
Reviews.Author: NYorksYorksTraveller
Reviews.Content: Had a long weekend in London and Faringdon Travelodge was close to KX station and reasonably priced. Wasn't expecting The Ritz and can put up with tired decor and a bit of traffic noise, but do expect basic room security. On check-in was given a key card to an already occupied room. I didn't steal anything and receptionist apologised. At midnight on Saturday night was woken by sound of someone trying the door handle and then an intruder walking in. He was lucky that he exited when I screamed at him and that i didn't have a weapon to hand or have a heart attack. Turned out to be a member of staff checking the room which they thought had already been vacated. What total incompetence.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a bit more and stay somewhere better”
Reviews.Author: tropicaltiger
Reviews.Content: stayed here over the august bank holiday, having previously stayed at other travelodges i expected basic rooms but in all the others the room has been clean and fit for purpose. The farringdon is the exception the room looked like it needed a total overhaul and the carpet was disgusting. The bathroom needed a deep clean and the furniture looked like it was from 1940. I can accept older furniture but can't accept a room that needs a good clean. The reception and restaurant staff were hopeless and their command of the English language was not the best the least i can expect is to be understood in an English hotel when i am speaking English. The upside however was you could just walk in for breakfast without paying and without anyone asking for your ticket to prove you had paid. Just with i had realised this before i prepaid. oh and to top it off if you are on the lower floors you get to hear the tube trains passing every 5 mins I will never return to this hotel i will instead pay a bit more and stay somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Farringdon Travelodge London”
Reviews.Author: baga1965
Reviews.Content: Myself and my daughter travelled down to london from grimsby by train to kings cross,we came out of kings cross and walked 10 mins down pentonvile rd onto kings cross rd within 15mins we were in our room,room was basic bathroom was a bit on the scruffy side paid for all inc breaky which was very good value for money overall it was good very ideal location for all the attractions which are all 20mins by bus,would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge should be ashamed of putting their name to this property!”
Reviews.Author: MRGB1
Reviews.Content: This is singularly the most disgusting property! Despite the warning on their website stating "The hotel is an acquisition property and the rooms differ from the illustration and from standard Travelodge hotel rooms" I had the misfortune to stay here. The staff are sultry and less than friendly in that ex Eastern Block way. The rooms are small, very small and need total refurbishment. No radiator controls meant the room is boiling hot or cooler and very noisy with the window open. The bed linens and towels are threadbare and almost see-through. The two pillows on the bed are so pancake thin I had to use both folded in two to make one decent pillow. One electrical socket had a sticker saying it had been disconnected for safety. The second socket should have been disconnected too as it is hanging off the abrasive artex stippled walls. As for the bathroom: filthy and beyond delapidated. Please see pictures attached which are not for the feint hearted. Old pathetic shower with mildew all around the bath tub and a leoginella encrusted plug. Brackets but no glass shelves. The breakfast offered scrambled egg from egg powder and was nowhere up to the standard at other travelodge properties I have stayed in previously. Travelodge offers consistent value accommodation, but at Â£80+/night this is appalling value. Do not stay here until it's refurbished. FYI I have no connection with this or other hotel chains.

Reviews.Title: “Very drab!”
Reviews.Author: Ernie M
Reviews.Content: I must admit I didn't do much research on this Hotel in advance as I've used Travelodges on many occasions and "you know what you get" - and they're well priced. Well thats what I thought but this was a real disappointment!. I was working near Farringdon and thought it would be close, in fact its nearer to Kings Cross than Farringdon. However the issue was the decoration and very drab appearance once you get past the "front of house" and bar etc. On the 2nd floor walking down the corridor at night was almost "scarey" as it was dimly let and was more like walking through a prison! The room although large was for 1970's guests with holes in lampshades (looked like burn marks) missing shelves in the bathroom and general tiredness. The room was big, noise levels good and breakfast OK but I'll definitely choose another Travelodge in future.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and neglected”
Reviews.Author: DarkEyedMe
Reviews.Content: One of the worst places we have stayed. Dirty and tatty. Rooms old, bathroom dirty. All neglected. Staff friendly but confused. Breakfast dreadful and not worth the money so dont pay for it! Low prices are no excuse for substandard surrounds. Reasonable placed but not worth the luxury. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “travelodge near islingdon and kings cross”
Reviews.Author: bren53Cork
Reviews.Content: stayed here for two nights on b&b booked thro' Hotels4u gave me clean typical Travelodge which represents good value for London the rooms are Large and eventhought my room was facing the main road i did not any noise also the buffet breakfast i had each morning was very good with a good selection. also all the staff i encountered were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and clean”
Reviews.Author: Knighton75971
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel a bit out of the way but it was incredible value for money in London for Â£19. The room had a double bed and the smallest bathroom I have ever encountered, but it did have a bath! The water was hot tea and coffee included and so had a brought sandwich and coffe for breakfast I did not find it dirty or dismal and also the staff were courteous so what do you want for the money.

Reviews.Title: “It's a lot better than people say it is!”
Reviews.Author: Scotsgent
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on the 14th November, having taken advantage of booking weeks ahead of my trip to London. I'd viewed the reviews before I booked and wondered if it was really that bad, but decided to book it anyway. I was not disappointed! To those who have griped and moaned about the property, it is NOT a Travelodge in the usual style; it is a hotel they have taken over and are modernising to their ways, but compromises have to be made as the company fits in their styles to an existing layout. You just can't knock it down and start again! Location wise from Kings Cross Station, it is about a 15 minute walk, or about 5 minutes on the #63 bus. Check-in was "clinical", no use of first names etc, but the clerk was friendly. My room was 210, a single room at the rear of the hotel, spacious as single rooms go, dust free (and I know all the usual dust hidey holes) - full marks to Housekeeping! The Bathroom was spotless; again no dust, and all surfaces smear free. However, the bathroom was a tad small. Functional, but tight space wise! Plus, the designer who decided where the toilet roll holder should be located, ought to be shot! it should be relocated where it doesn't physically rearrange your shoulder as you manouvre towards the loo! But cleanliness wise, full marks again to Housekeeping! Best of all, there was a heated Towel Rail in the bathroom, which in the morning meant the chill was taken off the bathroom; why can't other hotels follow suit? Other facilities in the room worked fine, except the light over the bed, but I reported that to reception on my way out, and later in the evening on my return, it had been fitted with a new bulb. I'd a comfortable night's sleep too. I didn't use the Cafe Bar in the evening, but later on when returning to the hotel, it appeared to be the most soulless place on Earth when viewed from the outside. I did however have Breakfast there in the morning. Yes, it is a self service Buffet style, but the quality was good, the food hot and fresh, and no complaints with the quality. But two small points. The Toaster runs at two speeds, dead slow and stop! You have to place your slices of bread in twice to achieve something resembling "brown" on a toasting scale! Whilst I had my breakfast at a quiet period, queues still built up at thr toaster. Attention Travelodge - install a second unit, increase the browning rate on the units if possible and delays will quickly reduce. Secondly, the Juice machine was faulty; Orange Juice came out as 98% water, 1% Colour and 1% Flavour. Even though personnel were told it had obviously run out of juice, in half an hour when I was there, no-one fixed that flavour. OK, I'd one of the other choices of juices, and the rest of the breakfast made up for the shortcomings of Orange Juice availablility. Yes, the building is a bit tired. Yes it obviously has seen better days, but to all those who have griped before on other reviews, read the online brochure. It clearly states that refurbishment in ongoing and that contractors will be working in the building from 8am to 6pm; construction noise might even occur. Thus, expect all of that when visiting this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised and when in London again, will book ahead for this hotel. As stated in other reviews, I'm an ex-Hotel GM, so I see problems from both the staff and the customer viewpoints. There are no problems with this property that can't be fixed during the refurbishment. Give it time; the hotel and its staff are doing well already.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service and a free upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Lovely_Liv
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel expecting the worst, the walk was further than I thought from Kings Cross but when I got there I was greeted by the friendly receptionist. I asked for a quiet room so they put me in one at the back of the hotel and gave me a double rather than the single my company had paid for. The room was basic but very clean. The doors do bang but I had ear plugs so didn't hear a thing. It's great for a cheap overnight.

Reviews.Title: “D.D.D........ Distugusting.Dirty, Dated !!”
Reviews.Author: SteveEllie2008
Reviews.Content: We booked this for our Anniversary and having never traveled to London before we wanted something quite central. We were given a room on the second floor. There was rubbish on the floor in the lift on the way up. Before we even got to our room we noticed there was a huge crack running the length of the corridor and half the hall doors had handles missing. The room was extremley dated with artex on the walls !! which had not been decorated in many years. The lightshades had holes and burn marks on them.Unfortunately we did not notice that was a massive stain on the mattress until on the day we were due to leave, The window had mold around it and on the wall. The bathroom had rusty plug holes and a dirty bath. The shower which was above the bath had a dirty shower head,shelves were missing and cracked tiles, The list is endless. My advise is don't stay here, it is a distusting, dated and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but what do you expect for Â£30 for a family of 4”
Reviews.Author: Richjaneowenleah
Reviews.Content: The hotel could have been better, but we paid only paid Â£60 for two nights. 10 mins to Russell square, and 5 mins to Leicester Square (on the tube) Need I say more, you can get alot better. I am afraid you will have to pay alot more. We used Virgin trains, to get to Euston (from Manchester) Â£40 return. Bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Travelodge for Kings Cross area”
Reviews.Author: SuzyT10
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here numerous times over the years, and although in desperate need of refurbishment and redecoration the rooms are still clean, sizeable and serviceable. Due to late arrival we ate dinner after 9pm. The staff were very helpful & the food was excellent quality and very tasty. We ate the 'all you can eat' breakfast buffet the following morning. This was also good value and freshly cooked. Try the coffee first before drinking, though - you might prefer tea instead! The number 63 bus via Kings Cross travels past frequently. Overall this is still a good value hotel especially if you can get it on a deal rate.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting - avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: fam1lyof4
Reviews.Content: This travelodge was booked by my mother in law as we were all travelling from Scotland to London for a family wedding. There were 8 rooms booked for a party of about 20, some of them family rooms. At the time of booking, my mother in law requested that we all have rooms together. The member of staff she spoke to told us that the rooms on the top floor had recently been refurbished and if we called nearer the time they would place us all together on this floor. As we were all arriving at different times, we were checking in at different times and 3 families booked in together. We were given a room on the top floor which had obviously been vacated that morning as the beds were unmade, wet towels were on the floor, dirty cups laid about and it stunk. After complaining, and after discussion witht the housekeeper who insisted the room was clean, (her attitude stunk even more) we were moved to a room on the bottom floor right next to a road which was tiny. Chaos ensued afterwards as each of us were all booked under the same surname and when families arrived, they were checked into an already occupied room, luckily it was a family members but they would turn up to the room with a key to get in and find it occupied. After several hours carry on, we were all housed. the rooms themselves were really in poor shape, skirting boards were well worn and in need of painting. The bathrooms, if you run the water too long (Its an open shower), the water comes out into the bedroom. It really was a disgusting place to stay and to be honest, for the money we paid, which did not include breakfast, we would have been better off in a Hilton. The breakfasts were reasonably priced but vile, we sent ours back. We ate out. It isn't even a nice area to walk about in at night so bear that in mind if you are using the tube. We were located in a room two floors up and it was right above the car park so when coach loads were arriving or leaving then we would hear them, along with the bins being emptied and collected of a morning. I would never come back here again, i have been to other Travelodges, paying a 1/4 of the price and had better rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Travelodge not a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: buts
Reviews.Content: This is perhaps not the best Travelodge that I have stayed in interms of standard of cleanliness and decor : it needs a thorough redecoration and tidying up but it is in a good location. It may be 15 minutes to the tube station but it's easier and much more interesting to walk. I walked from Euston Station and then after checkin walked to Fleet Street along the Embankment to Somerset House and up to Covent Garden. The following day I walked through Hatton Gardens to Smithfield Market.. After a traditional Sunday lunch in a deli(Â£9.95 for 2 courses) I walked to The Foundlings Museum near Russel Square then to the Welcome Institute and then acros the road back to Euston. I'm not a young person but didn't find the walking difficult. I found the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful. It was a bit of a bunfight at breakfast but managed to get some food. it wasn't fantastic but tidied me on til lunchtime. Although this isn't the best Travelodge, it does provide adequate accommodation in the centre of London at a reasonable price. You're only going to be sleeping there so you do n't want the expense of faclilities you aren't going to use.

Reviews.Title: “right room means everything”
Reviews.Author: Alan H
Reviews.Content: The room was dated but ok for the price in London, but and it,s a big but, make sure you ask for a room that is at the rear of the hotel as you will get no sleep with all the street noise at the front. I,m a good sleeper but this was unreal, the windows are old and let the sound and drafts straight in. The good things about this hotel are the fantastic breakfasts & how clean everything is. A good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2 & a half stars.”
Reviews.Author: nestonlad
Reviews.Content: This was our least favourite Travelodge out of the nine we have stayed in.. The room & en-suite were small & the walls & ceiling were covered in a heavy stipple. Our room was at the rear of the hotel so it was quiet. This said the room & hotel corridors were clean & this is the main thing. We got a good rate for our night stay & would use the hotel again at the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Least comfortable bed in London?”
Reviews.Author: JasonB77
Reviews.Content: I stay in various Travelodge hotels around London about once a week and although basic they are functional and one can at least get a good nights sleep. However the mattress I had at the Travelodge Farringdon was simply not fit for the purpose - you could feel the edge of every spring on the surface and it was so soft you rolled down about 6 inches in the middle. I have had better nights sleep on an airbed with a puncture! The shower was also pathetically weak and it was a struggle to get wet underneath it. I would advise travellers to avoid this Travelodge at all costs and go to one of the other newer ones around London.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a budget short stay”
Reviews.Author: Andy9761
Reviews.Content: I'll be short and sweet. Location is a 15 min walk to a tube station to pretty much anywhere. But other hotels are a little closer and are worth considering after a days hiking around London, another 15 mins seems to be quite long. Hotel is tired but staff and service very good, added bonus of breakfast. Saves a few pounds. Rooms need updating...quickly... Free wifi in bar area only not in hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “great stay our 2nd time”
Reviews.Author: diane r
Reviews.Content: read the reviews before we went in august to this hotel was not happy but when we arrived staff were really friendly room was very clean went again in september this time had breakfast which was very good at the end of the day it is not a five star hotel and don't expect it to be i thought it was great value for money so dont take any notice of the bad reports on this site go see for yourselves. their is also a very nice pub on the corner if you turn left out of the hotel very good food.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: doremangeoff
Reviews.Content: Needs refurbishing. It was barely tolerable for a one night stay...stale, ill equipped with bodged "repairs". The continental breakfast was not worth the money. Only London could get away with this standard of accommdation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Jerry D
Reviews.Content: I happen to stay in the lodge and it was truly good.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Jillypom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated for Kings Cross. Maybe needs updating a bit especially bathroom but can honestly say it was quiet - we were in a room at rear. Breakfast adequate to start the day. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: A.Brouwer
Reviews.Content: I only stay in Travelodge when I can get a good rate. So when I needed a hotel for sept 9-11 in central London the Travelodge Farringdon seemed the only option. I paid 90 pound for 2 nights which is reasonable for a central London hotel. The hotel is basic and no frills.It's a big and ugly building between the Kings Cross and Farringdon stations. Both stations are a quite long walk from the hotel so consider taking bus 63 which stops at the front of the hotel. The hotel is somewhat shabby but my room wasn't bad at all. The shower was small and not very good. It can get hot in the room altough there was a fan in my room. I know the television in a Travelodge room is not always working properly but my television worked well and had many channels. And yes, this hotel has a noise issue altuogh I sleeped well.

Reviews.Title: “awful staff!”
Reviews.Author: bexyb81
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with 5 friends for 1 night in august, the hotel itself was ok, although my friend had to sleep in 1 of our rooms as there bed was like sleeping on a bed of knives! we arrived early afternoon and had booked early check in on 1 of the rooms, so we dumped the luggage then went off to the west end to see the 2 shows we had booked to see. we then didnt arrive back till just gone midnight, after 10 minutes of ringing the bell a member of staff appeared for us to be told our room had been givenout to someone else that wanted to move rooms! we were offered 2 singles but werent happy with this(what if i had been with a child!) then a gentleman arrived and said he had bgooked 2 rooms but now only needed the 1 so we could have his other room, only for him to then be told he didnt have a room either, so we were both offered to be transfered to covent garden which we happy with as we were a party of 6. then 10 minutes later a room all of a sudden appeared for me and my friend! funny how there wasnt 1 10 minutes earlier! the room we then got was standard travelodge so was happy. I did leave a pair of designer sunglasses in the room, which although is my fault i rang up the hotel when i got home to be told no one else had checked into that room so thay would propberly still be there, but they werent so i can only assume housekeeping stole them as they were expensive! and i know 100% that i left them there as i took them out of bag as it was raining and didnt need them!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and used”
Reviews.Author: Chorkey58
Reviews.Content: To say we stay every week in a different city and country this is in my top ten of the dirtiest hotels I've been too. Old and used but not cleaned well needs a complete gutting and a new cleaner employed Paid 130 pound for what i ASK

Reviews.Title: “Beat the scramble !!”
Reviews.Author: Marlene&John
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend here for Trooping the Colour.Not bad location and one of the few Travelodges to lay on breakfast. Though do get down early to beat the scramble and I dont mean eggs lol. It is total bedlam as its everyman or woman for themselves, so when you actually get to the grub stock up and get your fill as its a long time coming out again when they decide to top up the servery. Food was fine the accomodation good and reasonably priced, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay budget hotel for London”
Reviews.Author: FunnyAnimal
Reviews.Content: The prices for London are very reasonable which makes this an acceptable budget choice. It is a bit of a walk from the train and tube stations. Not too many good restaurants nearby. There is traffic noise from the main road so get a back room if you can. The staff were friendly and helpful and even hailed a cab for us. The restaurant and bar are not worth the bother, you can do better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: VNC05
Reviews.Content: Welcoming staff, clean and bright rooms, good breakfast. Well worth the rate we paid and will use it again on my next visit to London.

Reviews.Title: “Out dated, dirty, bad customer service !!! dont stay unless desprite”
Reviews.Author: sarahlbanks
Reviews.Content: for Â£80 you would expect the basics but this was taking it too far for a well esbalished company !! the wallS were just about standing in the corridors and one lift was broken and the other just about working !! THE CUSTOMER SERVICE WAS DISGUSTING !! i arrived and was told to check in on computer by myself !!! ON arrival to room the room was open with a plumer in the bathroom he left 10 mins in x Then when the room had the most flat pillows i asked for spare and they said they didnt have any !!! i said its a hotel what do you mean !! they said there was knothing he could do !! JOKE JOKE JOKE !! there was also a man working round in a tank top behind the reception for no reason !!! MASSIVE dissapointment !!!

Reviews.Title: “Past best before date....”
Reviews.Author: Adele S
Reviews.Content: We booked a saver room, so for Â£29 in london, it is reflective of the cost but I wouldnt pay more for the room... I have stayed in travelodges before and know to expect basic but I was still disapointed. The room was shabby and dated, the bed was uncomfortable with non-existant pillows. The bathroom well..., the sink blocked, the shower was a small trickle, there was mould around taps, it may have been clean, but felt dirty because everything was so old.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory - not expensive so good for the money - let down by uncomfortable matress”
Reviews.Author: DoctorAndy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lodge, since it was just Â£35 per room per night in Central London. This is no money, so expectations were not high. Have to say that it was generally good. The reception staff were friendly enough, and the room was fine. For sure it was noisey, but that's to be expected in Central London. My main issue was the mattress on the bed. In fact the double room had two single beds together. The matresses were worn out, and well in need of replacement. Had it not been for this issue then I would have awarded four star rating. Other issues were that the fire alarm repeatedly sounded one morning, without prior warning. Also the shower was not all it could be.

Reviews.Title: “Run down but cheap”
Reviews.Author: RKMS151
Reviews.Content: We wanted a budget break in the city and at Â£160 for three of us for to nights it certainly was cheap. However, it has to be said that the room was very tatty, with a fuzzy tv and a dirty window whichh had to be open at all times as there was no aircon. The heavy traffic noise, day and night, was not very relaxing. The service was also not great. Despite having booked a room for three people we only ever got one towel. There was no phone in the room so this meant endless trips to reception which was miles away! Maybe you get what you pay for, but i wouldn't go back!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad.”
Reviews.Author: killer_butterflies
Reviews.Content: The worst thing about this Travelodge is the location, it's a good 15 minute walk from King's Cross, and we weren't too keen on this in the dark, it's not a rough area necessarily, but we just didn't fancy it. It was also on a very noisy main road. It was hot, and we needed the window open, but this kept us awake. Our room was as you would expect from a Travelodge, small and a bit dingy, but not too bad. We were pleased to have a singlebed instead of a sofa pull out bed, as we have had in a Travelodge before (there were 3 of us). It was also nice to have a bar/restaurant downstairs, though we didn't use it! It was very good value for money, we paid Â£35 each for 2 nights stay. We only used it as a base really, we weren't in there a lot. Didn't deal much with the staff, we checked in electronically. We did ask for more pillows and towels and they were happy to provide these.

Reviews.Title: “One night was enough.”
Reviews.Author: Theophania
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a hotel/theatre package. Was convenient for Russell Square and St Pancras underground stations. Room was missing a remote control for the TV, when one was asked for at reception they could not provide one. Drawers were broken in the room and the bathroom had not been cleaned properly. Very noisy street noise outside. Breakfast was OK, although staff arguing with other guests made it less than peaceful. Overall, adequate for one night if you are not going to be spending much time at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as what everyone was sayin”
Reviews.Author: lindawalsh2
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 6 nights bed and full breakfast. just me and my 11 year daughter. i was a bit unsure going here as i had read all the reviews before i arrived. we were greeted by a lovely asian man and checked in early, got to r room which was number 445 which was to the back of the hotel. room was clean all that was needed was extra pillows as the ones that was there was very thin. we got clean towels every day along with r bins empied and fresh soap. noise wasnt to bad at night in fact i wud say there was morer noise from the guests going to there rooms than outside at night. breakfast was all u wanted to eat good choice and as i had paid for full breakfast my daughter was free.staff were all friendly . we also had dinner twice in the hotel which was lovely. i thought overall it was a good hotel and we only paid Â£335 for 6 nights b and b.i wud def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Warmed to the location as had such a great time in London”
Reviews.Author: Hamlet60
Reviews.Content: Yes it is a dubious location . The directions on the web site are poor, to the utter embarrassment of my daughter, I nearly checked into the Royal Scot up the road.Room was fine and clean.My daughter had checked on the website before coming and had got to grips with the concept of a budget hotel "nothing is included to keep costs down" The old adage applies for this hotel you get what you pay for . I suggest you book here and spend what you save on a good time in london.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Wendy50
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a theatre break and didn't have any problems! Can't comment on breakfast, because we didn't have it. (There are much better and cheaper breakfasts all around!) Room was clean, facilities fine. Bed WAS a bit uncomfortable because of some springs sticking up, but nothing we couldn't deal with for a couple of nights. Turn left out of hotel (away from London) and there's a lovely area full of bars and restaurants. (Exmouth Market I think). Didn't find the area threatening at all! Traffic noise, yes - but it is London!!

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!”
Reviews.Author: AJF143
Reviews.Content: My standards arent very high atall, i understand that with cheap rooms, what you pay is what you get, but this is worth about Â£1 a room!!!! After previously staying in EasyHotel, Possibly the cheapest and most basic hotel around a few months ago, we decided to up it a little bit and pay the extra for a travelodge as we have always known them to be clean and slightly more spacious than easy hotel. How wrong were we. On first glimpse of the room on the first night, it was ok, id read the reviews on here and just thought to myself its just people being picky, its fine, the drawers has stains everywhere, and were chipped and worn and if a child was with us could have easily got a splinter off it, and when i went to put my stuff in the drawer the front fell off! we just laughed it off and said well atleast the beds clean which i had checked for bed bugs after reading reviews, but getting into bed that night was awful, we had a double room but it was 2 singles pushed together and were unlevel! and springs were everywhere! was like laying on a bed of nails! we had to get up and go to reception to move rooms, it was AWFUL! Getting into the second room, the bed was much better, a bit hard but i wasnt in pain!. We slept for the night and left early in the morning not really having a proper look around, it wasnt until the next night we realised there was a huge issue, The light was hanging off the wall with screws almost falling off, the plug had been smashed and has wires hanging out the back which is VERY DANGEROUS and is completely illegal! and to top it off it was right next to the childs bed! that could result in disaster! oh and also to add if you have children, check their beds! because it was exactly the same as our last one and had springs everywhere. There was a dirty cobwebbed light in the bathroom and the sink was blocked so much you couldnt even really run the tap more than 10 seconds. Sorry to be graphic but there were dried bogies all over the wall down the side of the bed!!! and finger nails!! and the radiator was rusted and peeling. The floor had a huge brown stain on it, and to top it all off we missed our jack the ripper walk due to the shower not changing from scorching hot. Yes i know how can you not notice all this before and stay in here for even one night, it was late and we were tired and went straight to bed. In the end we complained, the shower was checked and could not be fixed, the room was a huge hazard and we had to leave to go to another hotel which i might add only had 1 available room at Â£230 a night!!!!!! The staff were rude and unhelpful, the receptionist stood and just basically said well what do you want me to do! we got our night refunded so we could afford the last night in a different hotel and we have written to head office to hopefully gain a full refund! This hotel isnt what you pay for atall, i dont know what its like for sure but i reccomend you spend that few pound extra and stay in kings cross travelodge just 2 min up the road. Farringdon is in need of closure! and extreme refurbishment. I will not be returning to any travelodge after this experience. But if you insist on it then just to let you know about the only good thing was the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Andy_maggiepax
Reviews.Content: Staff uninterested and rooms filthy dirty. Breakfast was a joke! Plastic knives and forks and slow service. Staff gave no explanation except it's busy and I quote "it's always like this". Bedroom was awareful. Dirty bathroom and tiny bed. Complained twice during my stay and again and each time the staff just didn't care or do anything about it. I normally stay in the other two Kings Cross Travelodges when I'm on business and always had a great stay with them but this hotel really let's the company down. Don't stay here it will make you re think staying with Travelodge ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid unless desperate”
Reviews.Author: davidpardey
Reviews.Content: A mattress with springs sticking up, no lights in the bathroom and queues to check in with just one member of staff who was struggling with the complex system. Traffic noise starts at six. Take slippers to avoid putting your feet on the carpet! Prices in Sumer of Â£170 per night are a rip off

Reviews.Title: “1 Star flea pit!”
Reviews.Author: flossieYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights b&b for the purpose of a theatre/ London break. We were given room 302 and greeted with a dingy, tired and somewhat grossly looking room. We were however in a rush as we had theatre tickets so quickly dropped off bags with the mindset of 'we are only sleeping and washing here, so lets go enjoy London!'. Wrong............... We arrived back shortly before midnight very tired and crawled into bed. We very quickly departed said bed with the realisation of the mattress worn out, springs poking out at us and then to our horror, we pulled back sheets to discover wet stained patches, lots of other? soiling and threadbare centre with a bug crawling about. We were so disgusted, we went immediately to reception to find that no manager on duty, just a young eastern European male whom could not offer a solution to us as the hotel was already full and overbooked; the nearby Travel Lodges too were full in capacity. No apology, alternative room or mattress at least was to be offered. We layered the towels on the mattress and then lay on top of quilt, a sleepless night ensued. Next morning at reception, all eastern European staff i might add, were unable to contact manager as he was quote 'too busy'. We were offered a room change if we came back at 16:00; as we had pre booked theatre tickets this was not an option so they advised that our bags would be placed into said different room and a new key card would be waiting for us upon our return late evening. Upon our return, we were given room 305, which did have a somewhat more acceptable mattress but an horrendously and filthy bathroom. Previous guests hair, dead skin and gunk in all corners of bathroom, mould on tiles and bath rim with fungus around tap and shower fitting! Oh boy were we frustrated, tired and uncomfortable. Another awful night ensued, a strip wash with sink water and tiptoeing around the filth laden floor and barely sleeping fearing bed bugs. We felt nothing but anger for the hotel in ruining an otherwise wonderful time in London. We were so glad to check out of this non de script, disgusting, filthy and flea ridden establishment. I think Travelodge management should carefully think about their 'Sleep Tight' advertising campaign. This Hotel breaches every health & safety aspect, it is clearly uninhabitable in parts and is far removed from ANY other hotel we have stayed at previously - In England and worldwide! We are not people that like pretentious and posh hotels, nor do we expect a 'showroom' when staying at a hotel. We do however expect clean and habitable rooms to base ourselves whilst enjoying the area. The Travelodge Farringdon is a Health & Safety nightmare, a building that should be avoided at all costs, we would not stay there again if offered a fee let alone free of charge. Please, please check your mattress at the least, if you have already booked to stay, equally too ensure you keep your footwear on especially in the bathroom. Take wet wipes for washing as these, not ideal, but a far better option than hotel offerings....... Beware too in the breakfast room. The food is not rotated, just piled on top of existing. The crockery left wet through in sink/washing up residue, cutlery a lottery - maybe a steel fork but a plastic knife and the rest consume with caution! By the way, we didn't get a cheap deal here, we paid almost Â£100 a night, so can justify our review with integrity!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ashan65
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel, our room was clean and the bed comfortable although the pillows that were provided with rather thin and there were only two of them (with one spare). Our room was at the back of the hotel overlooking the car park, there was a little noise at night from the surrounding properties and a train line somewhere in the distance but certainly nothing to complain about. The hotel is only a brisk ten minute walk from King's Cross, which is a big bonus and we felt that Â£75 per night bed & breakfast was really good value for money in central London. The quality of the food provided was good but the service pretty poor unfortunately, which was its only real downfall. We stayed for 3 nights and on the 3 occasions we attended the restaurant for breakfast, there was a distinct lack of cutlery. A few plastic knives and forks were left for the guests to use, the supply of which eventually ran out as well leaving the full English breakfast a non-option (unless you were willing to tackle a plate of bacon, eggs and sausages with a spoon). The explanation given by the staff was that the cutlery was hard to clean, which in my opinion was an unacceptable excuse. The hotel did seem to be rather understaffed, which may have been a more reasonable explanation had it been offered. All in all we enjoyed our stay and I would definitely use this hotel again if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Yes it's basic but it's not horrendous...”
Reviews.Author: kimbob21
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for two nights in two rooms - rather than leave a big diatribe I'll try to be objective: pros - the price -for two rooms for two nights it came to Â£139 which is an absolute bargain. We booked at the beginning of the year so got special offers but for central London this is really hard to beat. - the room size - our room was big with plenty of space - facilities - we had tea/coffee in the room and our bathroom was clean and the shower was good. - staff - all the staff we came across were pleasant and helpful cons - the road outside was very noisy.
