I live on a main road and so I am used to some noise but here the windows offered no soundproofing and as a result I got no sleep at all. However family staying in the other room we had at the back of the hotel said they had no problems with noise. - the actual hotel is not an original travelodge hotel, they bought it off someone else. As a result there's weird buttons and other odd looking electrics in the work that have all been disconnected. It's not a big problem but it adds to the shabby feeling about the hotel. - location - for me and my husband it was fine - around 5-8 mins walk from kings cross but for my disabled brother in law it proved to be a little more difficult to get around easily. - The TVs did not work in either room - again not a problem for me but in the evening my brother in law is limited to what he can do and so was disappointed to not be able to watch tv. Overall I'd stay here again if I could get the room so cheaply...it's a travelodge and so from the outset I knew it was going to bargain basement and we spent so little time in the room the faults were not a problem for me. I've definitely stayed in equivalent/worse places which were more expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Grubby and old”
Reviews.Author: MGB1979
Reviews.Content: I don't hold great expectations when I step over the threshold of a budget hotel. I've stayed in enough of them to understand the arrangement; that is, I part with a reasonable sum of money and in return, I'm provided with basic, familiar, clean and comfortable facilities. I donâ€™t expect to be greeted by an army of servants; I donâ€™t expect designer toiletries, I donâ€™t expect sea views, I donâ€™t expect Michelin Star cuisine. Sadly it seems even these humble hopes are too much to hold, certainly judging from my visit to the Travelodge Farringdon. The reception area was nice a bright and airy and afforded a much needed coolness after dragging our suitcases through the oppressive London heat. The room (205), however, was less welcoming. The decor was tired and grubby, the lampshades were burnt, and the wood panelling was scraped and worn. The double bed appeared to be two single bases pushed together with a filthy double mattress placed on top. Because the bases were old and worn there was a hard ridge up the middle of the bed. These factors combined to ensure we didnâ€™t get a decent nightâ€™s sleep. I understand that companies need to earn a profit and may tighten their budgets accordingly but when a hotel chain can no longer provide a decent bed to sleep in, it's time to stop and think. Luckily for the customer there is no shortage of competition, and that's exactly where I'll be going.

Reviews.Title: “Well below Travelodge standards”
Reviews.Author: flc0211
Reviews.Content: We have used Travelodge on numerous occasions, and have always been greeted with a clean, basic hotel that has met our requirements for the purpose we were to use it. ie. a base for us to sleep, shower and store our clothing. Unfortunately this hotel is very very tired. The room was in need of a bomb and then rebuilding, dirty artexed walls that were mouldy and smelly, windows screwed shut, tiles missing in bathroom, a shower or rather a dribble that was neither use nor ornament, a wardrobe with 3 hangers (we had to go and beg for more). The room appeared to be a single with a double bed wedged in so no access to one side unless you climbed over. We attempted to change rooms but no more available, so we showered in our friends room which was in just as poor state (only their shower worked). Unfortunately our loyalty to Travelodge has now ceased and we will be trying other companies from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Was better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: LFK
Reviews.Content: Compact and bijou, the best way to describe our room, asked for a quiet room and got one round the back on the top floor (509). it was clean and the bed reasonably comfortable. Breakfast was very good by Travelodge Standards. Was late when we got back to hotel and went to bar to order some food, but no sign of any staff anywhere, gave up after about 20 minutes of waiting and got some snacks from the vending machines, annoyingly the bar man came out of his hiding place then! Note to Travelodge Management, you missed out on a lot of bars sales Friday night! The rooms have seen better days and are in need of some re-furbishment. I was with my teenage daughter and felt reasonably safe, but like one of the other reviewers, I would steer clear if I were a single lady traveller as the night staff did seem a bit odd. Would stay again if there was nothing better on offer for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Is this the worst hotel in London?”
Reviews.Author: chasgunter
Reviews.Content: Travalodge currently run a TV campaign featuring a teddy bear explaining how much care the hotel chain takes to ensure a good night's sleep. Not in this hotel they don't! The first thing to strike me was the pungent smell of mildew coming rom the bathroom. The room was dismal; decorated from ceiling to floor with textured plaster. ( I hope it doesn't contain asbestos). The toilet didn't flush properly so I had to fill a small bin with water from the bath several times and flush that way. The shower was a dribble; the kettle was plugged into an electrical socket that didn't work; some of the drawers in the room were screwed shut. The hotel is on a main road so I expected to hear some traffic noise. But the sound insulation in my room was so poor, I amy as well have tried to sleep outside. The noise kept me awake for most of the night. The bed was comfortable enough but I was cold and there were no extra blankets/quilts. I might have been able to get one from reception but that would have meant getting dressed and going down five floors. Breakfast. Not too expensive but cheaper and better in the local cafes. It was buffet style and like most of the these, I had to put the bread through the toasting machine several times to get anything resembling toast. The area was small and trying to reach the food was something like a rugby scrum. The bacon was OK but the sausages were dreadful and the srambled eggs resembled minced tennis balls (but more rubbery). The coffee was undrinkable. In fact the Nescafe provided in the room was better than the 'fresh' coffee from the machine in the dining area. At Â£86, not the most expensive hotel in London but not the cheapest either. I have stayed in Lodndon hotels that were both cheaper and better. Is this the worst hotel in London? I haven't tried them all so I don't know but it must be a contender. My advice would be, "Don't stay here unless you are deaf and devoid of the senses of smell and taste or else are desperate. Don't eat here. there are better and cheaper places locally."

Reviews.Title: “If you're desperate”
Reviews.Author: COMuggles
Reviews.Content: What a huge let down for a last night in London. Small, smelly, gross bathroom, no air movement (other than a little fan) hard beds, tiny, very noisy-lots of door slamming. You could hear everything outside. I was quite re-leaved to leave!

Reviews.Title: “What a dreadful fleapit - don't book here!!”
Reviews.Author: Rododog
Reviews.Content: Booked in via machine which then stopped working mid-way. Tried to find a receptionist and after 5 mins one appeared with a phone stuck to her ear so didn't want disturbing. In the foyer there were two foreign people who were becoming aggresive because the internet connection they had paid for didn't work. Got to bedroom and was shocked that in this day and age even basic hygiene is not a priority, No shampoo, hairdryer. Tea, coffee and sugar sachets had been opened and sprinkled all over the dressing table. Pillows?! If you can sleep on something half an inch thick (even with two on top) then you're welcome. Shower didn't work. I think I was sharing the room with Mr E Coli. Absolutely dreadful. The outside of the place says it all - looks like a prison block,.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For.”
Reviews.Author: Kimm1988
Reviews.Content: London Farrington is cheap, but not overly cheerful. Not to mention the staff, who seemed to offer the bare minimum in customer care without any pleasantries. Our room was fair for the price payed. The only complaint I would have about it would be that the double room had two single beds pushed together rather than a double bed. That, and the toilet looked a bit grotty. However, I would advice anyone considering staying here to skip on the food available there. We ordered room service from the bar during the day. The receptionist doubled as the chef and took around half an hour to service us chicken dippers, nachos and a slice of cheese cake. The food was terrible and resembled something bought from Asda Smartprice; The chicken was processed, the nachos were foul and the cheese cake was still frozen.

Reviews.Title: “Great service.”
Reviews.Author: Confusedsquirrel
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed in London before as was naÃ¯ve to think that the hotel prices would be reasonable. This was the cheapest hotel available where I did not have to share a bathroom or bedroom. It's very basic and dated, but you get a bed and a bathroom - what more do you need? The service was fantastic and the staff were always more than happy to help. I requested a room change during my stay due to the noise from people outside the bar downstairs at 2am, and this was organised for me with no hassle. Overall the quality of this hotel is not he best but if it's the cheapest around then you can't expect much more. You get what you need along with helpful service but I wouldn't voluntarily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “STOP WHINGEING!”
Reviews.Author: jim_sue_falconer
Reviews.Content: I read some reviews before our trip and took most of the negative ones with a pinch of salt. Get real folks, this is bargain basement priced accommodation in the the middle of Europe's busiest capital city. The place was clean, room just what you would expect and the staff were pleasant and cheerie. Plenty cafes/ restaurants within 5 mins walk and 2 pubs vurtually next door both with good food. Only ten minutes to walk into Bloomsbury/Russell Sq/Southampton Row where you can use all your internet restaurant discount vouchers and lots of pubs to call at on the way back. No 19 bus just down the road and you can have a scenic tour right through the West End and onto Knightsbridge. I think people really expect too much for the fairly piffling sum this place costs!

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping on the street would be a better choice.”
Reviews.Author: Razol
Reviews.Content: Dirty, no soap or shampoo, no front desk staff (check in by machine), no one to register a complaint with. The room was hot and the window opens only a crack. There is so much noise from traffic that sleep is not possible unless you just pass out, nevermind the creaky uncomfortable bed. If this hotel is your only choice, you should just sleep on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Whats all the fuss about ?”
Reviews.Author: kj5556
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last sunday night and was very wary after the awful reviews. I need not have worried. Yes you have to check in by machine but so what ? It took one minute, and a very helpful lady on reception oversaw it, and immediately changed my room to a quiet one at the back of the hotel. She was very pleasant and asked if i needed any further help or assistance. Excellent service. The room was clean, tidy, and indeed quiet with an excellent tv and decent bathroom. The bed was comfy and spotless. For Â£19.00 i simply could not find fault in any way. The location is not the best, and its easy to go to the Travelodge Royal Scot by mistake, but if you are departing from Kings Cross as i was its just fine. I simply do not know why this hotel gets such negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Damp mouldy smell”
Reviews.Author: MrMrs101
Reviews.Content: Stayed in rooms on the ground floor and they all had an awful mouldy damp smell which has made all the clothes i took with me smell horrible. Not worth Â£80 a night would not recommend it to anyone. Also problems with 2 members of staff trying to enter the room before our checkout time.

Reviews.Title: “Finally the management of Travelodge should realise they have crosse the line between price and value”
Reviews.Author: Mw4572
Reviews.Content: What a terrible place, you have to check in by machine, Â£15 for parking, Â£8 for breakfast but no eggs becasue the delivery is latr and the Eastern European guy is so unhelpful but comes up with a great solution, if I want to go to the shop and get some eggs he'll ask the chef to cook them!!! The beds have seen more action than a premier footballers girlfriend(s). Well below the travelodge standard, ironically there is another one 1/2 mile away and that looked nice. Summary...Hell hole staffed by (only) undertrained young people

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Lis092
Reviews.Content: reading about all the bad reviews made us worried. we arrived at the hotel late at night, we had no trouble with the automatic check in. the hotel was welcoming and even the staff members were all friendly. The room was spotless clean, so were the showers, Television was fine and heaters - everything worked! the only problem we had was because the lift wasn't working and we had to carry our luggage to the second and third floor. Anyway, i highly recommend this hotel. I mean, what do you guys expect? It's cheap and efficient. We loved it, and we'll surely be back.

Reviews.Title: “you pay a lil more to stay in Travelodge King cross”
Reviews.Author: kirstenlau
Reviews.Content: "what you pay if what you get". We booked Travelodge Farringdon because it's near St. Pancras(Eurostar to Paris), and we couldn't afford a hotel like Renassiance (the hotel above St. Pancras) so we booked 2 nights at Travelodge Farringdon, and the other night at Travelodge King cross (cause it's full house on the 3rd night) If you take the bus to kingcross, you will get off right in front of the hotel, so this is the only good thing I could think of. The water was not strong enough to wash off the shampoo, other than that, everything is what I expected (low cost hotel). I think Travelodge King cross (few blocks away from Travelodge farringdon) is a little better, and it's closer to St. Pancras/King cross station. Easy self check-in and easy self check-out. Basically dropped the key card in the box when you check-out. By the way, we only took 15-20 mins walk to Angel (bars area)

Reviews.Title: “I found it passable, my colleagues had trouble with the bed”
Reviews.Author: canningtown
Reviews.Content: I stayed with colleagues for one night. I got a reasonable night's sleep, although most of my colleagues didn't, the beds seemed to be two single bed nailed together, and for one colleagues, two single mattresses of different levels of comfortableness. It was clean. The location's not brilliant as (compared to other hotels) it's not near any tube or rail stations. The rooms were adequate (although the shower in my room was very lame). We were all on the top (5th) floor so that kept noise away as much as possible. I can't comment on the service as we didn't interact with a member of staff. Due to the queue in reception we checked in using the computer terminals. And don't use the book-a-taxi phone in reception, it cost twice the price of flagging down a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't agree more with last review - awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: AllenDale2
Reviews.Content: As well as the uncleanliness of the room and the shabby nature of the dÃ©cor and furniture in 3 different rooms that they gave me, the guy at the desk told me that Travelodge deliberately overbook the 525 rooms here by about 15. He was unable to offer me a cleaner room because they were overbooked on Wednesday night.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay of my life”
Reviews.Author: Fluidhydraulics
Reviews.Content: This is without a doubt the worst hotel I have ever stayed in during my 20 plus years of travel. The room was unclean, hairs in the bathtub, burned patches of carpet from an iron, no plastic covers on the plastic glasses (makes you wonder if these are new plastic glasses or leftover from the last guest). They couldn't afford to put a loo paper roll holder in the bathroom, could not afford to put hangers in the closet and could not afford to put a functioning remote control for the tele....oh and they must be worried about guests stealing batteries as the battery cover on the remote control was screwed permanently in place. I got no sleep due to the slamming of doors during the night and all of this for 110GBP a night!

Reviews.Title: “would never go back”
Reviews.Author: haylesNorthants
Reviews.Content: Those who are familiar with the travelodge chain will know that it is a no frills hotel with a cheap price tag. I have stayed in Travelodge's in other parts of the country and have found them to be clean, large rooms which for the price was a good deal, NOT IN THIS ONE! There are 3 travelodge's in the kingscross area, we arrived at the wrong one by mistake (not their fault i know) the right one as it turned out was just a 100 yards down the road from the one we had arrived at, however the receptionist who did not speak english well directed us to one that was quite some distance away, we dragged a baby and our luggage half way round London before being directed to the right one. Once there we found the room tiny, dirty and without even the basics such as a phone, working kettle, bath mat, enough towels and working TV remote. I went down to reception to get a replacement kettle needed for the babies bottles and although they were helpful the replacement kettle was filthy. Only one power socket worked and the room was extremely hot. that night we didn't get a wink of sleep due to the noise outside and in the hotel with constant slamming doors. They also have a policy (which in fairness we knew about before getting there) that they do not look after luggage, which is a pain if you are spending the day in london but are not staying another night. I have stayed in London many times over the years and on this occasion we wanted somewhere cheap and chearful as we were on a budget, for Â£30 a night you would be hard pressed to find that price in another hotel, however I would rather pay another Â£100 than stay in this hotel again as even the basics were not covered. I would recommend any person thinking of staying here to shop around and stay somewhere else instead!!

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what the fuss is about”
Reviews.Author: Bigalt2861
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on here, my partner and I were really worried about satying the 2 nights. We were visiting London to see Phantom of the Opera. On arrival we were greated by 3 self service check in computers that seemed to be rather efficient, there was a member of staff on hand incase we got stuck. The room was rather small and dated, but thats what you expect from the Travelodge buisness model. Tea and coffee, flat screen tv, en-suit bathroom with a decent bath and shower. Room it's self was clean, a little more attention wouldn't go a miss in the bathroom and public areas. Yeah the hotel is about 1/4 of a mile away from the nearest tube, but very regular bus operates 4/5 mins through the day and 15 mins through the night, just 3 stops from King's Cross Station. Some people seem to think they can pay a cheap rate and get the service of the Hilton. we paid Â£35.00 for two of us for two night. That was excellent for central London.

Reviews.Title: “Steer well clear !!!!!!!!!!!!!! you have been warned”
Reviews.Author: mrtoad1
Reviews.Content: I was booked in here by my company as i was attending a function at the Grosvenor House Hotel that evening, upon arrival i was attended to by a snotty receptionist who really couldn`t be bothered......then there was the room ...what a treat that was, the bathroom was out the 70's and looked like it hadn`t been cleaned since the 70's the bed dipped horrendously in the middle, there is no ventilation in this hotel and it was boiling, i did ask at reception if they had a fan or something as I was literally dripping with sweat sitting in the room, reception could hardly speak english so i decided to forget that, when i arrived back to the hotel at 11pm it was even hotter, i ended up checking out at midnight getting a taxi to Kings Cross and got the train home !!!! so I never got to experience that awfull bed

Reviews.Title: “Good if you happen to get a cheap deal”
Reviews.Author: Treborwf
Reviews.Content: Stayed Sunday 1st May for 1 night. Usually stay at Hilton hotels but wifey decided that Â£15 per night was too good a deal to miss out on for a night away in London so she had booked here without my knowledge. Unfortunately as she is American she is not clued up on what Travelodge hotels are all about nor where the Farringdon area is in relation to doing some central London sightseeing. After reading some reviews on here I knew to expect a self service machine at check in, a gentleman that walked in directly after us and hadn't read Tripadviser was castigated for daring to approach the reception desk. Self service machine had printed out our pre paid dinner & breakfast vouchers, our room number & issued the room key, all without the need to need to see a real person. The room was very good for Â£15 & but had I paid a lot more I would have felt hard done by. Small 20 inch TV, coffee & tea making facilities, no air conditioning, only soap in the bathroom & no shampoo, 1 bedside table (so a pain if there are 2 of you). The bar opened at 5pm, so no drinks or early dinner prior to this. The bar area seemed fine apart from it needed a good clean (think dry ketchup stains on the table & crumbs all over the place) & the seats & tables were conducive to having a relaxing drink, definitely hard on the back when eating dinner. As mentioned earlier we had pre purchased our dinner & breakfast, I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food for the price (akin to average pub food, e.g, burgers, fish & chips, lasagne etc.). Had I paid more I would have been sorely disappointed. Breakfast was all you can eat buffet, again, for the price very good for what you got. Wife loved the burnt bacon because it reminded her of crispy American bacon - it just reminded me of burnt bacon. There is another Travelodge 5 minutes to right of the hotel heading towards Kings Cross station, a Holiday inn directly in front of the hotel, and a pub & small convenience store just to the left of the hotel. Definitely not an area I would want to hang out in unless I had to as there isn't too much to do in the vicinity & the staff at the hotel reminded me of dealing with androids, albeit androids with bad attitudes.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great...”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_Corfield
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights while in London on business and as a fairly inexperienced hotel guest I was unsure of what to expect. Firstly, the hotel is a 10-15 minutes walk from Kings Cross, this doesn't sound like much but can be frustrating considering it's about as far as you can get from a tube station in London. The hotel is nice, dated, but nice and the staff were always friendly (special mention to Karol, who worked on the bar each night) and were never rude. However the rooms were missing simple things such as plug sockets next to the bed for charging phones, a small annoyance but as I'm sure you can imagine, quite annoying when you have to walk across the room just to read emails/messages in the early morning. The rooms were basic (make sure you don't forget shower gel, shampoo etc. as none of this is provided) but felt clean and safe and the hotel bar, while not being the trendiest in London, felt inviting and comfortable. The real problem came at breakfast, I didn't expect the finest breakfast in London but I expected more than what was provided... I don't want to go into the gory details but I'd highly recommend walking towards Kings Cross and eating breakfast somewhere (read: anywhere) else. All being said, if you get a good deal or are staying for work then you'll be fine... just don't expect more than fine.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: Kate1004
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed for the weekend at the Travelodge Farringdon after reading mixed reviews. Basicaly if you haven't booked it DON'T- spend a little bit more money and stay somewhere else. If you have booked it, it OK. its about 10-15 minute walk to the tube (kings cross) it's in a safe area, but our room was small, dirty and damn hot! There are much better travelodges and cheap hotels in London then this one. Its only highlight was a fantasic Vietnamese resturant up the road. I wouldn't stay here again, and will definatly spend a little bit more money next time!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect a decent nights sleep here!!”
Reviews.Author: twittwoooootexan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at London Farringdon Travelodge in the past and expected a little noise, but this time we were put on a floor with a whole school of children who ran wild down the hall all night--slamming doors and talking and running loudly. Some consideration should have been given to where the guests were placed, but instead we were just checked in randomly by computer. Also, the beds were the most uncomfortable I've ever slept on in a hotel, I had to put a duvet between me and the bed just to avoid my back breaking. There was makeup on the pillows, and a burnt lampshade... who knows what else was lurking that we couldn't see? Also the shower had two temperatures--scalding and boiling!! Horrible stay and almost ruined our trip as my husband and I were so tired as we didn't get a full night's sleep either night we stayed. We will never stay in this Travelodge again. For the amount of money we paid we probably could have got a cleaner hostel--the amount of teenagers running wild there would have probably been equal!!

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Jimmbo1912
Reviews.Content: Yes it is what is says on the tin, basic accommodation, 10 minutes from Kings Cross station, central for all of London! Beds uncomfortable, 3 pillows on the bed??? You would either have 2 or 4, when we asked for an extra pillow, we were treated with a look of disgust, you would think we had just asked for a new bed!! Breakfast poor, and not enough staff to cater for a busy breakfast room. We certainly would not go back. Reception staff are Rude, if looks could kill, i certainly would be 6 ft under, all because they had not swiped our key cards for the full stay, and had to keep going to reception to get them done again, obviously to much of an effort to do it right in the first place!!! My advice, go to Holiday Inn or Premier Inn which were both a few mins away!!!

Reviews.Title: “What's all the fuss about?”
Reviews.Author: macartney_john
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in many different places down the years, while on business and for pleasure. These locations have ranged from simple country farmhouses to full-blown 5 STAR luxury that seemingly only places like Singapore seem to truly understand and provide. In our experience, the Travelodge Farringdon didn't tell us any lies and we'd summarise our stay by saying the hotel "does what it says on the tin." Our room was Â£46.00 odd for a double (and it WAS a proper double bed) on the ground floor, overlooking Kings Cross Road. We weren't at all troubled by traffic noise - and there was plenty of vehicle movement outside our window (probably triple-glazed?) throughout our stay. The room was clean, well ventilated and we could control the heating / air-con ourselves. Yes, there were periodic distant rumbles of the Underground, but this is Central London, for heaven's sake! Foodwise, we could have eaten in the hotel and what was on offer looked quite appetising, though we didn't try it. As we'd had an exhausting drive in heavy motorway traffic to get here during the morning and early afternoon, we had an afternoon nap. In the early evening, we walked a short distance along Farringdon Road where there was a delightful little Italian restaurant on a crossing near the Mount Pleasant Royal Mail Sorting Office. We strolled back afterwards and had an early night in readiness for our appointment this morning. No, I don't think "we were lucky" by our experience. Our room and the hotel entirely fulfilled our needs and we'll certainly go again as the need may arise. In the event we may prefer unashamed luxury and flunkies at our beck and call the next time we visit London, there are always places like The Ritz on Piccadilly, The Dorchester on Park Lane, The Savoy on Charing Cross Road and many others in Mayfair like Brown's Hotel and Claridges to name but a few. But I doubt any of those noble establishments do a quiet, clean double room with en-suite, TV and tea/coffee making kit, for under fifty quid a night. These days, you get what you pay for and all we wanted was somewhere, clean, comfortable, quiet and budget priced. Travelodge Farringdon ticked those boxes. End of story.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by all those reviews!!!”
Reviews.Author: carlydins
Reviews.Content: We booked a weekend break to London and this hotel was included in our package deal. However, having read the reviews on trip advisor before we went we certainly weren't looking forward to staying here. However, I must say that we were pleasantly surprised!... OK the rooms were alittle "dated" however, they were clean, comfortable, safe and served their purpose well and the "All You Can Eat Breakfast" was excellant! I would certainly recommend this hotel to those who are simply looking for a cheap hotel (and can put up with the traffic noise outside...but surely that's what you would expect when staying near Kings Cross station).

Reviews.Title: “there will be a next time ;-)”
Reviews.Author: tootsie15
Reviews.Content: My 80 year old mother and I stayed 3 nights in Travelodge Farringdon. We were wellcomed by Solomon who gave us very good rooms. All the members of the staff were kind and helpfull. English breakfast was ok. The rooms were clean-also the bathrooms. Only the corridorfloor and the mirrors of the toilets in the basement were not 100 % . The busstop in front of the hotel made it easy for us to visit the centre of London. I will certainly book again in Travelodge Farringdon.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Beckyred89
Reviews.Content: I actually read these reviews after booking the hotel and was dreading staying there. I was pleasantly surprised by our room, it was clean and tidy, no signs of any bugs or mould, there were a few stains on the mirror but nothing too bad. The only downfall was the 2 single beds pushed together to make a double but it was still comfy. The bathroom was clean and I thought the shower was better than ours! I would stay again, it is value for money if all you really need is a place to rest your head in-between exploring London.

Reviews.Title: “Good luck”
Reviews.Author: Joe02206
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in early January 2011 and I would have to say that this would have to be one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. Upon check in we were advised that the lifts did not work and had not for 4 days so we had to carry our own luggage 2 flights of stairs, we went to the bar to get a bucket of ice only to be told that this to was broken and the final straw was when we went to use the shower and it to from what we were told was also broken. The rooms are very ordinary for a 3 star hotel and smelly; staffs are not very friendly and helpful. This hotel is well below its star rating. Definitely not a recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish!”
Reviews.Author: p1980g
Reviews.Content: To be fair this hotel was very cheap - however compaired to other travelodges that I have stayed in this one was dirty, noisy and not the location was rubbish! It is off a main road and there are sirens and traffic all night - there is no airconditioning but you cannot sleep when the window is open because the noise is too loud. The rooms are very dated and thre are marks and stains all over the furniture and carpets. Only one lift worked and it took an age to come - when it did it stopped at every floor even though there was no one waiting. The hotel is located a fair distance away from any tube station, the nearest one is Kings Cross which is about 10 minutes away (i know that this is not that far but in central london it is about as far away as you can get from a tube!). This is a very grotty hotel that i would not recommend - pay a little bit more and stop in the covent garden travel lodge.

Reviews.Title: “If this is your first impression of London you would leave rapidly!”
Reviews.Author: roastpotato
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to attend a wedding. As Londoners ourselves we know that service is not a strong point but even we were blown away by the rudeness & indifference of the staff and felt thoroughly ashamed of the impression that they gave of London to the many tourists that must pass through their doors. Obviously they have never attended hospitality courses or failed miserably! When we arrived it was hard to get the person on receptions attention and it was a enormous effort to check us in we really felt as if we were intruding. We wanted to have a quick bite to eat & drink before getting ready (it was 13.00hrs), we went to the bar area chose pizza off the limited menu & stood at the bar to give the order (alongside some other guests). After 5 minutes one of our party went to reception to ask for attention and was told "its just me & the deputy manager here do you expect us to run the kitchen & bar too". When we came back after the wedding again their was nowhere to get a drink ...except with our kettle in the room is this a b&b or hotel? We had three rooms, same price varying sizes. One room was adequately sized good value for money, our room was like a box room with double bed in it not good value. The other room was also small. The rooms badly need refurbishment and it would be good to be able to open the window. My daughter was woken at 9am in the morning by a man asking if she was leaving , we presume he wanted to clean the room, checkout was not until noon. My daughter was so freaked they phoned us in our room for reassurance, we went up to look for this man but couldn't find him my daughter & her friend chose to leave. We paid additional money for early check in which was pointless as there was nowhere to eat & drink in the hotel and it was not convenient to go out as we needed to get ready for the wedding , so we ended up bringing fish & chips in - hotels usually forbid this but they really didnt careless. Top tip excellent breakfast on Sunday morning round the corner at at cafe in Frederick Street, good service. We chose this hotel because of the reputation of Travelodge, having stayed at Travelodges in different locations. We completed a survey sent to us by Travelodge after the stay reporting all that I've written above sadly I never received a response, not good.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cran4
Reviews.Content: My second visit to this Travelodge simply due to it's relatively low cost for London and its location - close to Kings Cross and a nice walk in to town. Although it would not appeal to those who require luxury, the rooms have seen better days, and only 1 lift works it is clean and comfortable for a short stay. At some point Travelodge will refurbish it and you will end up paying a lot more to stay there! Look out for the Travelodge sales/best offers from their website and book well in advance. For me I would rather spend the money I save at one of the great local restaraunts than twice as much on a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Travelodge ever but perfectly acceptable for the price”
Reviews.Author: KateDan2
Reviews.Content: Biggest problem is that its a bit of a walk from the tube station- about ten mins through not the nicest area of London. Our sink wouldn't drain away the water for ages and the shower leaked. Beds were saggy but not the worst. In general, the hotel is fine for what you pay for it. If you want luxury stay someplace else. There are two other travellodges on the way to it from Kings cross which would probably be better but overall, It was fine. Suited what I wanted which was someplace clean to lay my head.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for what I paid.”
Reviews.Author: JAPLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night after an office party, rather than travel home. Paid Â£35 so quite happy with the room. Decent size. Flat screen tv with some freeview. Shower was very powerful. All clean. Howerver the bed had a huge ridge running all the way down the middle (due to 2 singles havng been slotted together). Staff were fine, though like a lot of budget outlets I found that you needed to smile at them first before they'd smile back! Bar area is attractive, overlooking Farringdon Road (admittedly not a great view). Again, like a lot of budget hotels they have cut right back on staff and services. Had to wait 5 mins til somebody turned up to serve me at the bar. Found the ice machine not working and one of their drink fridges not working. All in all though, so long as you're not expecting much, I found it clean and fit for purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Find an alternative”
Reviews.Author: Mooles
Reviews.Content: We swear by travelodges and use them wherever possible for a good value, low cost base as we spend little time in hotels when away. However, this is really poor. Some staff ok - some not. Beds that are like camp beds and sag in the middle; bathrooms with everything hanging off and a poor shower in terms of power; tatty rooms, and in terms of locations you are talking a good 10 mins walk in either direction to either Farringdon tube or Kings Cross. All in all we definitely wouldn't stop here again and would either use the Kings Cross ones or where possible the tower bridge one which was excellent (although to be fair that on is pretty new so it's always going to appeal a bit more...) Do stop in Travelodges - just find an alternative to this one. Some are much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are grumpy and rude. Nice bar though. Rooms could do with a refurb.”
Reviews.Author: theotherstu
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Thursday night as my other half had a business meeting on Friday and I was working from our London office. Checked in fairly late - note you book in electronically (I did ask if I could check in and the grumpy assistant simply pointed me to a terminal). Food stops at 10pm although this wasn't the case as we were told "No Food" at 9:30ish. The rooms have new carpets and some decor, but it's not very modern. If you've come from continental europe then think "Formule 1" in the 1990s when they were dismal places to stay. It was clean, I suppose and the beds were fairly OK. Not good enough, though. Not somewhere I would ever choose to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: strudledoodle
Reviews.Content: I had paid for early check in and had the proof with me but the receptionist who could barely speak english just said NO after raising my voice a gentleman came out tutted at me then gave me the room key,The room was big but very outdated and was overlooking the main road,I thought I would never sleep but to my total shock I slept like a log! Breakfast was great and well worth Â£7.99. The breakfast staff were also very nice(if only they were receptionists) I would stay here again if I got a cheap room but would not if I had to pay more than Â£50

Reviews.Title: “"Do not stay at this hotel - it is not fit for purpose- pubic hairs in the sink!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: toni15
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on 15th January 2010, Checked in on the self service machine which allocated us rm 422. Headed up to it, it was opposite the lift meaning it was going to be extra noisey. The room was tiny, it was small and pokey it smelt of damp the sealant round the sink and bath was all mouldy and black, not to mention the pubic hairs in the sink!! The toilet clearly had never been descaled or cleaned throughly. I went back to reception and was told that we would be moved to a 'superior' room I found this quite funny as travel lodges hardly have superior rooms. We were moved to room 440 whcih was only marginally better as there was a lot more space. But the lights did not work properly they were flickering on and off as though there was a sprit trying to talk to us. In the end the only light we could use was the bathroom one. The bathroom filthy again toilet in need of a good clean, generally a very dirty, grimy hotel in need of a major refurb or even better knocking down and starting again. The bed was worse than sleeping on a concrete floor the base was broken, and the matress sagged and our feet were higher than our head as it was so uneven!! I haved stayed in many travelodges and this is the worst one i would not recommend it even if you pay a saver rate and get it for a good price. Traveloge you should be ashamed of yourselves!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could this be the worst Travelodge...”
Reviews.Author: Fredlet101
Reviews.Content: This was booked for me as I was attending a conference at the Barbican. I'd requested to stay at the City Rd Travelodge, where I'd stayed before, but this worked out a little cheaper. I arrived at 9 pm on Sunday to find the electric door shut and no-one at reception to let me in, a fellow guest eventually letting me in. They have those electronic check-in machines which seemed fine and I was assigned room 205. The lifts are currently broken so stairs it was. The room was basic and very dated, the double bed two singles with metal sprung mattresses pushed together. Despite this I slept well. Awoke to find the shower useless, the thermostatic control was broken so nothing but very hot water. On my return to the hotel that evening I requested a room change and was given a very similar room but on the 5th floor - but at least the bed was more comfortable and the shower sort of worked. In conclusion avoid this place, it's noisy dirty and in serious need of some tlc!

Reviews.Title: “Well located and cheap but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Turnerm1966
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated between Kings Cross and Holborn giving easy access to both the City and the West End. The room was small and dated. The proximity to the King's Cross Rd meant it was impossible to sleep without earplugs. The flimsy curtains didn't stop the glare from the street lights. On the plus side, the room was clean. If booked well in advance the hotel was cheap when booked with 'no flexibility'

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again”
Reviews.Author: laura250
Reviews.Content: I booked this travelodge - kings cross because it was reasonable price and sounded nice!! On arrival - no body to answer the reception- after ringin bell several times Staff were very rude and couldnt be bothered to talk to or help you rooms were unclean and walls paper thin cigarettes outside front of hotel Partner got woken up to drilling too I know travelodge is cheaper but i would never recommend this hotel ever

Reviews.Title: “Remember it's the Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: taylinYork
Reviews.Content: Well, it's the worst Travelodge I've ever stayed in, but I always believe you get what you pay for. We spent 3 nights here for less than Â£80, so cannot complain. However, if you'd paid more I could see the issues. Location - it's nowhere near a tube station. Kings Cross is the nearest at about a 15 minute walk and with the day travelcards at Â£5.60 each per day, it made for an expensive location. The walk into Central London was too far from here. Cleanliness - The rooms are really, really dated, although our room seemed clean, the bathroom had cracked tiles with mould, but nothing you felt unclean in. Towels were changed everyday. Sleep Quality - Questionable. It seemed that we were lucky to get a room on the back of the hotel, however, there was a very loud, constant droaning noise 24 hours a day, which without ear plugs was a problem. If you are just using the hotel as a base as we were and using it just for a bed you will be fine.... but only if you get a cheap rate.

Reviews.Title: “Don't touch this hotel with a barge pole!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dazzerTauntonUK
Reviews.Content: please see email i sent to Travelodge as a complaint! I stayed at the Farringdon Travelodge, Kings Cross Rd London 31/12/10 for one night in triple room 119. Firstly i would like to bring to someones attention the extremly poor standard of upkeep i found the room in during my stay. The hotel was full, so there was not joy with a room move. The bathroom was grumby, and the cracked and jaggered tiles on the shower wall were what i would call dangerous, as a slip would of resulted in a cut!! There was filth on the surfaces and mirror was a mix of dirty smears, cracks and rust! Of the 3 single beds only 1 was fit for purpose. the others had bases which were 12inches narrower than the matress meaning even sleeping was a balancing act. There was 3 people staying in the room, but on 2 towels! a request was made for more towels, they never appeared. The staff were miserable and to ask for anything you were made to feel as if you were requesting the world!! the only exception being the male who was serving breakfasts. I have stayed in numerous Travelodge hotels around the country and this hotel ranks as the worse and probably the worse standard of national chain hotel i have ever stayed in! I feel so strongly about the poor standard of hotel that i will always think twice before booking Travelodge again. the hotel and the majority of its staff is a disgrace to Travelodge. DON'T BOOK THIS HOTEL< YOU WILL REGRET IT!! TAKE A TENT AND CARDBOARD AND PITCH WITH THE DEMONSTRATORS AT PARLIMENT SQUARE INSTEAD. IT WILL BE MORE COMFORTABLE!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic stuff, easy to get to and good location but itchy sheets...”
Reviews.Author: DBenedict
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just one night whilst on a business trip as it was convienient and close to where i was visiting. This is a very basic and old style hotel. the reception and bar look appealing and are quite newly fitted but the room I was in was in need of a revamp. the walls are quite thin so if you need a quiet night (like I did) then this is probably not a good place to go. It was also very small but at least the shower was warm in the morning. I also had very itchy sheets... I'm not sure if it was just psychological but it also contributed to a restless night. I would recommend checking out the holiday inn across the road...

Reviews.Title: “Not the best - would not return”
Reviews.Author: TLCLJP
Reviews.Content: On first impressions it was not as bad as expected, however it is only when you really start to use the basic facilities you start to see why others have not recommended this hotel. House-keeping On arrival it was relatively clean however house-keeping had left a cleaning rag in the room and despite us placing this in a very obvious location, it was not removed before we left two days later. We had two sets of towels when we first arrived however they only replenished one set of towels (bath towel and hand towel) despite the fact that there were two people staying in the room and clearly two toiletry bags full of male and female products. There is no phone in the room so you can't call down to reception - so good luck if you really need something or you are in urgent need of help. Bathroom: One very small bar of soap provided - that is it in terms of toiletries. The hot water from the shower was non-existent. We could only have hot baths, but as there were no small face washers/face towels provided this wasn't the best hot bath I have ever had. Others in our group had no water pressure but had scalding hot water dripping from the shower. Bed There were two single beds placed together to become a "double bed" with a single bed in the room too - we named this the "naughty bed" - it was the bed you slept in if you were naughty. The bed linen was ok in terms of cleanliness however it is very thin and not the nicest sheets I have ever come across. The mattresses were dreadful - no support and if one person moved in the "double bed" the other would then be raised on an angle - think see-saw effect. Eventually you would roll towards the middle but then sink so the sides of the bed would raise. We could not hear much street noise, it was relatively quiet. The nearest tube is a good 15 minutes walk away however there are some reasonable cafes/restaurants near-by. If it was one night, you can cope but I avoided coming back to the hotel to relax as it really was uninspiring. Only stay if you get a super cheap rate.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good start....”
Reviews.Author: candy_xyz
Reviews.Content: Got here to a self check in, we arrived a bit early xpecting to be able to leave our bags in the bag room, there isn't one! So we had to wait until 2.30 to be able to check in to leave them in the hotel. So we decided to get some food while we waited - staff told us that there was no food on, only drinks. So I got a chocolate bar from the machine. So we decided to get a hot drink to warm us up - no proper hot drinks, only those from a machine, and even then there was no tea. Hotel looks great at reception bt the start was not great....

Reviews.Title: “Worst of the chain”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Stage
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many, many, Travelodges over the years and this one has to be the worst of the entire chain. Such an embarrassment for them. The front of the hotel is littered with cigarette ends. Once outside of the lift on my floor I came across open bags of dirty linen and open bags of rubbish all over the floor. I had to move them, with my foot, to make my way to my room. The tiles on the floor are all cracked and filthy! Once inside my room it was just more of the same. The whole room is artexed. Every time I brushed up against the walls it hurt. Not a very child friendly room at all. The mixer tap moves around when you turned the water on, making you think that the whole thing was going to break. The toilet flush moved in and out and up and down. Nothing seemed to be attatched to what it's supposed to be attatched to. The pillows on the bed are thinner than an After Eight Mint. The quilt cover is even thinner. I'll be passing this on to my company to recommend that we NEVER use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “worth the few mintues walk from kings cross”
Reviews.Author: syl188
Reviews.Content: only took 5-10 minutes to walk from kings cross station to this hotel, you do pass one other travelodge on route but this one used to be a 'thistle' hotel and recently been required by travelodge. the soundproofing windows were quite inmpressive as other hotels stayed at in kings cross have been quite noisey. the staff were friendly and the food prices were excellent, with the facility to take to your room available at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay in this hotel again and would advise colleagues to do likewise !”
Reviews.Author: Arny_Sacknusem
Reviews.Content: It was obvious at both the check in and the bar area that English was not the first language of the staff. My diction is good but repeating oneself time and time again becomes a drag after a while. The room (Â£116 per night breakfast not incl.) was very scruffy, light fittings hanging at odd angles, door frames chipped and scuffed and skirting boards in very poor condition likewise the carpets. The bedding (sheets and duvet covers) were very thin, probably due to age and the number of times it had been laundered. The bathroom was the highlight (read low light); mould around the edge of the bath, mould on the bathroom ceiling and on the bottom of the shower curtain. An interesting collection of broken wall tiles too. The enamel was chipped in the bath. The towel whilst a good size stank of bleach - possibly from the products used in the commercial laundry. The toilet seat was also broken when I arrived but this was fixed by 18:00 the following day. The highlights; the TV worked as did the kettle in the room. Shameful given this hotel is in our capital city.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons.”
Reviews.Author: WorldFuneral
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay in this hotel as an alternative to Travelodge King's Cross Royal Scot, where we'd had a bad experience. Travelodge Farringdon is about 20 minutes walk from King's Cross Station (and indeed, you walk past Royal Scot to get there!). The downside of this is obvious, but it also brings some advantages. You can often get good rates at Farringdon, and you're also away from the worst of the King's Cross noise (which is not to be underestimated). Our room was situated at the back of the hotel (we had a "bin view") and, remarkably for London, it was quite quiet. Even the sirens sounded distant. The room was quite run down, as expected, but it was clean and of a reasonable standard (and quite obviously not originally built to Travelodge specifications). We had two large single beds pushed together rather than a standard double, but they were much more comfortable than the typical Travelodge bouncy castle that passes for a bed. Would I go back to this hotel? I don't know. Having read other reviews on here, I can see that both this hotel and Royal Scot seem to be a gamble -- you don't know what you're going to get. It's fine if you get a room that's been cleaned and refurbished within the last 20 years, but otherwise it could be unpleasant. I wonder if Travelodge should maybe be investing some money in these hotels to bring them up to a more representative standard. Ultimately I would recommend this hotel for a one-night stay only, as the distance from the station makes it an awkward base. But if you can get a Â£35 room, you won't do better for that price (or twice the price) in London.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly OK”
Reviews.Author: ldawes6
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews we prepared ourselves for the worst and found it surprisingly OK. Rang a few days before and asked for a quiet room and we were allocated Room 3 in the annex. Very quiet, did not hear any noise at all. Room, yes is tired, however it was very clean with adequate toilet roll & clean towels. Location is OK, just 10mins to Kings Cross tube. Would stay again on saver deals.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I've stayed in in the UK”
Reviews.Author: Yelekreb
Reviews.Content: Travelodge are generally pretty good and fine for business travel. The Travelodge Farringdon is a disgrace to the group. It is located in a rough area on a busy road, but OK enough if you are careful. Firstly they tried to charge me Â£10 extra for checking in 20 mins early - this is the same whether its 2 hours or 2 minutes early - I didn't pay it. The reception/lounge area is OK. The rooms are stuck in the 1970's with artex ceilings and walls. No a/c. There was no toilet roll and no towels and the TV remote didn't work - this was quickly fixed by the helpful lady on reception. (She did ask if I had turned it on!). The room was grubby and tired. Debris under the beds and the bathroom is a shocker. It's certainly up there with some of the worst hotels I've stayed in. Very poor nights sleep. Bed lumpy and sheets worn. Room either too hot or too noisy if you open the window. Someone tried to open my door in the middle of the night too. I had resigned myself to just living with it all, but final straw was the comedy shower...too cold, too hot on/off, leaks and actually dangerous as it suddenly sent scalding water across my back...I now have a burn. Breakfast....awful. I didn't finish it (unlike me). To be fare the staff were pleasant and refunded the night. I checked out and have gone elsewhere. This is a shockingly bad hotel. Don't go there and then perhaps Travelodge will spend the money on the upgrade it badly needs.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back again in a few months - despite what negative reviews others might write”
Reviews.Author: NigelHudson
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel ! Coming from rural Yorkshire we actually enjoy the city night-sounds which occasionally intrude into the room. The bus-stops on both sides of the road are immediately outside the hotel on the Number 63 route from King's Cross making for an easy arrival and departure with heavy suitcases ( Lynne's fault ) and quick access to the tube network from there. Had breakfasts here twice this visit . The ample space in the food/drinks area and the staff's attention to keeping the tables cleared and the hot-meal sections topped-up made these the best 'Travelodge' breakfasts we've ever had, and, believe me, we've had quite a few. O.K. - The room was a little 'tired' - but 'Travelodge' does state this hotel was a not built to their specifications - though perhaps when sheets and duvet covers have holes in them it's time for replacement. The staff were always superb - especially 'Solomon' on reception. Booked during a 'sale' , so costing about Â£100 for a three-night stay, with breakfast on two mornings this was terrific value.

Reviews.Title: “Noisey,Hot and bit of a trek to tube!”
Reviews.Author: wisdompics
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in this hotel whilst in London on a leisure visit, our room was at the front of the hotel and i have to say was the nosiest room i have ever stayed in, i expected some noise but it really was relentless, It was mid week and the traffic never gave in day and night!!, We could not open the window as it was bad enough with the window shut,which ment it was incredibly hot!!, we were however provided with a small room fan which made it just about bearable. The nearest tube station is Kings Cross, do not make the mistake of getting off at Farringdon as its decievingly far away!. The room itself was old and tired, although was spotlessley clean,Except for the bathroom which was a bit grubby, the shower curtain and shower head needed a good bleaching and there was a very worrying burnt lamp shade which has to of been a fire hazard?? If you have to stay here ask to be put at the back of the hotel,where i imagine the noise will be a bit less. Also the card machine was broke, and although we never ate or drank here we saw some very hungry and thirsty travellers who didnt have any cash, which to say the least they werent happy about. There is budget and then there is Travelodge Farringdon!!, Avoid!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not great - even for the price”
Reviews.Author: DontLikeTheRain
Reviews.Content: Room badly needed decorating, lots of teenage drunks who were still crashed out in lounge area in the morning. Pay an extra 20 pounds and stay somewhere slightly better or further out & put the money on a taxi. I won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Day trip to Paris ruined by bed bugs and lager louts!”
Reviews.Author: martinlee84
Reviews.Content: My partner had booked a suprise trip to Paris for the day so we decided to stay in the travel lodge for two nights as it was fairly close to St Pancreas station, and previous Travel lodges have usually been satisfactory. For the Â£180 that we paid for the two nights i would have rather saved our money and slept out side with the dossers, it would have probably been cleaner and a more comfortable nights sleep! We were issued room 121 (avoid like the plague) which on first impressions you wouldnt let your dog sleep in, but being english didnt really like to complain after 10 minutes of being there! The rooms are ageing and really need an overhaul, weird colured stains all over the walls, rusting radiators and bathroom fittings, dirty cups, mould all over the bathroom as the extract system doesnt work properly, just generally not value for money, total rip off to be honest. So we decided to stay in this room for the night as we heard other people moaning about there rooms and came to the conclusion that they must all be the same. We were just about to go to sleep as we had and early train to catch, i turned the pillow over and there was a bed bug underneath, concluding with my partner that we didnt really fancy sharing the bed with strangers for the night we went down to reception to share the news. The understanding polish gentleman on reception by the name of Anton didnt care that we had found bed bugs and in fact laughed then accused me of lying! He soon listened when i said i had photos of the culprits! I demanded that we were moved room and he reluctently gave in, 538 was our next destination at nearly mid night! The second room was pretty much the same as the first, rubbish, but knowing we had to be up by six we decided to put up with it, we had a quick look over the bed for bed bugs, but we decided to sleep on top of the covers and use towels as a quilt. Just getting to sleep and half of the local night club come crashing down the corridor screaming shouting and then proceeded keep opening and slamming the doors whilst going between each overs rooms! We had a great day in Paris but decided that we couldnt stay another night in the hotel from hell, and now try and get some money back or the hotel shut down, because its day light robbery!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: foxy_london_lady
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for one night only. The hotel is about 10 min walk from kings cross station. The staff was nice, I was checked in before 3pm. The hotel is clean but a little bit older. I stayed in the family room, 1 double bed, 1 single bed and a sofa. The room was clean although a little bit tired, the beds were not very comfy but the central location for the low price makes it a very good value. There is no phone in the room and the tv had very poor signal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money, despite minor drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: distantmemory
Reviews.Content: We paid Â£19 per night for a double room. I believe that this represents fantastic value in central London. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. Although clean, the bathroom was tired and in need of a refurb. Some damaged tiles and a damaged (but functioning) tap. Staff were chearful and helpful. So, for a comfy nights sleep in a clean room, close to mainline stations, I'll certainly use Travelodge Farringdon again. The secret is to book well in advance to get the cheap deals.

Reviews.Title: “Standard travelodge motel accomodation”
Reviews.Author: tvoo
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews of this hotel I was reluctant to visit, however the price remained appealing compared to nearby hotels. On arrival I found the hotel to be very clean, the rooms were spotless, as were the public areas. The staff were friendly and amenable (we kept the bar open to 4.30am on one night). In fact it was like every other travelodge I have stayed in, basic but comfortable and clean. I had asked for a room to the rear of the hotel and there was relatively little traffic noise given the central location, the room was quite warm so I had to leave the window open. There is a bit of a step up into the bath/shower, and the incandescent light bulbs have scorched some of the lampshades [should be replaced by low energy ones by now] but these are honestly the only negative criticisms I have of this hotel

Reviews.Title: “AVOID”
Reviews.Author: jrb273
Reviews.Content: So many of the reviews below seem to be based on the premise that this is a budget hotel, and I am sure that if you are able to get a room for Â£30 then you might be satisfied (although the skip down the road would probably be cheaper still), however when paying over Â£100 on average per night you might expect some basic amenities. Among these I would include: a towel that isn't stained (I'm not asking for two - just as well - or even a bath sheet and hand towel, just one clean towel). Some shower gel and shampoo would be nice. A toilet that flushed properly, maybe. I was however amused by the pedal bin in the bathroom that would launch its lid into the upper atmosphere every time I pressed the peddle. On to the bedroom, I did get a double, rather too singles that had been pushed together. The mattresses were very comfortable, probably, about 20 years ago. Unfortunately when I stayed the springs had melted and it felt like a dehydrated water bed. Had some of the above luxuries been present I might not have minded so much about the fact that the bathroom floor was dirty, that the carpet in the room and especially the corridors had so much ingrained dirt that probably any attempt to clean would be fruitless, nor the unhelpful staff. On a final remark, perhaps the bar deserves special attention. The hotel does not allow check in until 15.00 (unless paying extra), nor do they have anywhere to store bags. So, should you arrive earlier then sitting in the bar until check in is your only real option. Unfortunately the bar is closed, almost permanently. I never actually found a time when it was open. Please don't assume that I wanted to drink there, I was just a bit bemused about why they bothered to have it at all. If crap hotels are your bag, go ahead and book

Reviews.Title: “Worst Travelodge - not even worth Â£19!”
Reviews.Author: thomasmolloy
Reviews.Content: I stay in Travelodges quite often - and naturally realise that I'm not going to get 4* quality at the price. However, I do expect basic functionality, essential maintenance and some evidence of cleanliness. (Before I go further, a word of warning - this Travelodge has single rooms, a rare thing with their hotels - so there's a chance you'll book the wrong kind of room by mistake...) I should say, to give the management credit, that they did refund me fully and without fuss when I reported the following. I appreciate that courtesy. I hope, however, that Travelodge corporately will do something about this specific hotel, which does nothing but damage to the brand. Worse, it appears to be the base for Spanish tour groups - makes me ashamed to be British! The room had been cleaned - the sheets and towels were fine - however, the bedroom had dust and mould on the walls, the chair would not fit under the desk - and there was no power to any sockets, meaning the TV, kettle and desk fan (no other air system) could not be used. The bathroom was extremely poorly maintained - or to be more precise, attempts to maintain it had made some of the problems worse. Dodgy (and consequently unhygenic) grouting/sealing, cracked sink, visible goo/god-knows-what in the sink drain, filthy toilet handle, filthy showerhead, shower curtain pink from mould and lack of washing... So, hardly slept from the heat (and for waiting for the repairman, who never did come to fix the electrics), and then felt dirtier for washing! I suggest avoiding this Travelodge at all costs. There are at least two other branches within walking distance - check Tripadvisor for reviews of those first.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: MrHotelLiverpool
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with a work colleague and a potential client whilst in the capital. The hotel is in desperate need of refurbishment and the rooms could do with an occassional dust and vaccum. More worryingly is the vermin that run around the public bar area, we witnessed several vermin running in and out of chairs (each chair has a hole in the bottom). Staff didnt seem particularly bothered with this and begrudingly gave us a refund for breakfast as we didnt intend eating in this establishment anymore. The reports of vermin on here go back as far as last year so it isnt the first time this has been spotted. We would certainly pay a little bit extra and sleep with Lenny Henry and his team down the road!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: backpacker123_10
Reviews.Content: Quite simply you know what to expect from Travelodge, dusty, dirty, lack of maintenance. To spend 1 million on a sleep tight campaign and not put this money to good use...perhaps hand out ear plugs as it was so loud we couldnt sleep. Also allow the cleaners more than 20 minutes to clean a room, this would deal with a lot of complaints throughout Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “Hot and noisy but a fair price.”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowGazza
Reviews.Content: Confusingly there are several Travelodges in the immediate area and I went initially to the wrong one. My fault, however a pleasant staff member pointed me in the right direction. Initial impressions of reception were not favourable - the receptionist who served me did not speak particularly good English and the rooms were accessed via lifts behind a security door entry (couldn't find the stairs). The room itself was at the front of the hotel and on the first floor above a very noisy road but as it was so hot and with no air-con the window had to be left open during the night. The bathroom was tiny and there was a single bed - not much room at all. There was a nice gastro pub a few metres away and several London cycle hire stations in the vicinity. Not the best hotel I've ever stayed in but not the worst either and I paid Â£29 for my room so no complaints about the price.

Reviews.Title: “a disgrace”
Reviews.Author: lit39
Reviews.Content: This is the worst travelodge i have stayed in.The room was on the small side,it was a hot day and no cooling system.The window,a small opening overlooked the busy main road and was so noisy we had to shut it during the nighyt.The walls and ceiling of stucco render were dirty with black stain marks above each light and long strings of dust on the ceiling. Handles were broken on the drawers,water was reluctant to go down wash basin,it didn't matter as there was no basin plug and take a look at the shower rail,ours was nealy all corroded and rusty.The corridor was scruffy. The bed linen was however clean. It seems this place needs gutting and money spent on it

Reviews.Title: “what do you expect for Â£29!”
Reviews.Author: ennismore
Reviews.Content: Was in London for two days and paid Â£29 a night. Luckily had a room at the back so didn't have all the noise from Kings Cross Road. Yes it's a bit run down and not in the best of locations. If I'd paid Â£129 I'd have been sorely underwhelmed, but at Â£29 I didn't have high expectations. In a bit of a wasteland but a half mile walk down Kings Cross Road took me to Exeter street and lots of great local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience I had in the world...”
Reviews.Author: mzc1978
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I stayed in Travelodge London Farringdon hotel last week. It was one of the worst stays I had for the recent years. Due to my business, I always travel to different countries and stay in different hotels almost 100 days in a year for the last 7 years. Therefore I consider myself as a good guest for all the hotels. I will never ever stay in any Travelodge hotels because they do not care about the guests, they only care about money. It is impossible to change anything after you make the booking online because the staff funnily do not have any access to anything. I made the booking on internet and paid it online. As I couldn't see any options on their website for a twin room, I booked a double room and sent an email as reply to their confirmation indicating that the room should be a twin room because I would be staying with my colleague and didn't want to sleep together. When I arrived, I realized that it was a double room with one big bed, and the room was very small like a grave. I asked the reception and they said I had to call them after booking the room. I said why are you doing online bookings if I had to call you overseas. I said I sent email indicating that it should be a twin room, their answer was the emails go to our reservations. So what? I said it is their business to direct my email to wherever necessary, I couldn't send emails to every receptionist separately, could I? I said I am not happy with this and I want to cancel it and wanted refund. They said they do not have access to the system and can't do it. He offered me giving the hotline number, but no telephone in the hotel even to pay and call. It was only first hour of my arrival, I do not have any call cards, but they do not understand anything. Anyway I realised that there is nothing to do other than sleeping together or going away with paying 107GBP for nothing. We slept together with my colleague that night unfortunately. I do not believe thay do not have any available twin room because the hotel was very uninhabited. Also I do not believe their word that all the rooms are same size, because you can not even open your luggage in the room properly. The receptionists even do not know how we could pay for their back door car park, you have to learn yourself. I hope my above text will help people to keep out of Traveloge Hotels and will make the owners or managers of the hotel learn how to take care of their guests in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Gorey_Wexford
Reviews.Content: This is a simple, clean, Travelodge reasonably convenient to where I wanted to be, At Â£37 ($56) for bed & breakfast in a central London hotel, this cannot be beaten. I'd have preferred airconditioning but a fan in the room helped. I phoned first to get a quiet room and got a single room at the back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the height of summer!”
Reviews.Author: kaffeee
Reviews.Content: Have just stopped for one night with my partner (the poor thing is down there all week for business!). Travelodges are usually good basic accomodation, this one is really letting their reputation down. It needs a complete refurb - wiring from old electrical equipment from 70s is just cut off, hooks fallen off bathroom doors, electricial sockets intermittant! I'm not fussy, when it's cheap I can happily live with a scruffy room, but the worst thing is the noise from the Kings Cross road (it doesn't stop all night) and the crappy little desk fan they give you for air con - it was a case of staying awake from the heat or the traffic noise - We chose the heat. Desk staff no better, asked for more hangers, took 20mins & then turned up with towels - said she'd go get some hangers - we gave up waiting! Taxi they booked my boyfriend for a very early train was a complete rip off - Â£12 for a 5 min journey! Only stop here if a) it's winter b) it's on one of their Â£19 a night deals and c) you take industrial ear plugs!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money. Scruffy, hot and dingy.”
Reviews.Author: nannafish
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just come back from a 4 day day break. Cost of Â£210 excl breakfast. Room was hot and stuffy, unable to open window but did have a v.small fan. Decoration was v.dated. Worse part was the (so called double bed) this was 2 single beds pushed together which seperated after a very short time. Also, rather strangely, a further single bed was in the (already small) room. We had not booked a family room but this was useful as my Husband spent the 3 nights in it. Remote control for t.v. gave up after 1 night and communication with staff was difficult due to language problems. We have stayed in several travelodges in London and this is by far the worst one. Quite a long walk from Kings Cross station. Will never use again.

Reviews.Title: “At least the lifts where nice!”
Reviews.Author: Dirk_18
Reviews.Content: I was scratching around for any positives about this hotel and the very nice looking lifts where all I could think of. Only staying for one night and didn't pay too much so wasn't expecting a beautiful hotel. Tiny room, felt unclean. The bathroom was tiny and looked horrendous with paint flacking off the walls in the shower and the toilet flush was broken. All in all not a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are too small, too hot and too noisy”
Reviews.Author: gizmo38
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in June 2010. Our room on the 3rd floor was extremely small, and the bathroom was also poky. It was far too hot in the room, there was no air conditioning, and if we left the window open, we couldn't sleep for traffic noise. The breakfast was OK, except for the croissants which were horrible.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: joyous1963
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews i had serious doubts about whether to bother going to the accommodation. I'm sure glad we did though. My husband rang ahead and asked for a quieter room which they accommodated....well a room at the back where you could hear the trains rather than front noise on busy road. Room was adequate, tea and coffee making facility. Fan was provided f necessary, flat screen tv. Check in was brisk and straight forward, breakfast was good value and plenty of choice. About 15 min walk to tube, but it's not a difficult walk. We paid Â£90 for 2 nights, which included 1 breakfast and 2 early check in payments as we couldn't book 2 nights together at time of booking!!!! Anyhow for BH weekend that was great price.

Reviews.Title: “The UK's Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: chugzy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in three Travelodge hotels in the King's Cross area of London on three different trips to London. All three offered great value for the money: Basic, secure accomodation, with decent beds in clean rooms. There aren't many frills included, but I've noticed that the rooms have been consistently comfortable. Our most recent trip put us in to the Farringdon location, which is the furthest of the three locations from King's Cross station, but it was still only about a 15 to 20 minute walk away. The hotels offers at an extra charge a very hearty buffet breakfast. If you're a budget traveller like I am, fill up with the buffet at breakfast, eat a light picnic or cafe meal at lunch, and splurge a little for dinner. The Travelodge hotels are perfect for budget travellers like us.

Reviews.Title: “OK....just.”
Reviews.Author: HatesCelery
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine. Its a travelodge like many others, could do wth updating i.e. furniture but we found it to be ok. For one night stay in london is ok. The road it is on is very busy and was very noisy at night, we had to have the window open so it was really loud and being on the first floor didnt help. The bus stop is right outside, and were heard everyone coming home at 3 am hahaha. apart from that for what we paid its fine. If you go in expecting travelodge then you will be ok.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ivelde
Reviews.Content: The roms were adequate but the staff is not friendly and the breakfast was Fawlty Towers style. Most of the time only half of the trau=ys were filled. The rest was not replenished.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking and complacent”
Reviews.Author: TellSyd
Reviews.Content: I stay in Travelodges, Holiday Inns, etc in London regularly for business. Normally Travelodges are a decent standard - this one is not. It is tired beyond any level of reasonableness; yes, I knew it was on a busy road, but surely the windows could offer better sound-proofing? The staff on reception when I arrived were appalling - an old-fashioned 1970s, anti-customer service attitude, to the point of outright rudeness. The whole floorplan is bizarre, with stairs back to reception marked "fire exit only" and weird intermediate wooden pannelling separating the lift area from reception. The room itself was shocking - tiny, noisy, grotty bathroom (though clean), and fittings that were 10 years beyond their use-by date.
