I would not stay here again unless the only other option was a park bench.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: Alanrush
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after a concert at the Barbican. This place needs a lick of paint. The room was at the front and has seen better days. Also got woken up by the traffic on Kings cross road. Breakfast was a joke. They ran out of plates so i was sat there while my two freinds ate there breakfast. I had to ask three times for a plate. The staff where just not bothered. I will not stay here again. I am off too the Barbican in July and have booked a premier inn room.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: imj79
Reviews.Content: I hate this hotel. The rooms are very basic, it was too hot, the bathroom is tiny, there was lots of noise in the corridor. Hated it - would never stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Last Resort in an emergency”
Reviews.Author: sideburnsdave
Reviews.Content: Good location , about a 10 minute walk from Kings Cross. Ideal for an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “sufficient for basic stay”
Reviews.Author: ril_zd
Reviews.Content: the location is OK. nearest tube station is King's Cross about 15 minutes away walking or just hop in the bus 63 down at Gwyen Place bus stop. the facility for tea making is sufficient, but once, the cup wasn't replaced. the cleaning service is quite puzzling, someday the room was cleaned with the thrash bin bag wasn't placed. then, the toilet was like 1/2 way cleaned, and the other day only 1 towel was left instead of 2. but the staff are nice & responsive especially the cleaner when we asked them to clean up our room. stayed at the room facing the king's cross road. its quite noisy, and made me awake in the middle of the night. checking in and out was fast.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but excellent value and clean and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Wadgie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights - hotel about ten minutes walk from either Russell Square Tube or Charing Cross Tube. Much nicer walk from Russell Square Tube station which is situated near a handy shoping centre so you can stock up on water and snacks etc. The Hotel is fairly large and as with all Travelodges, no frills but excellent value for money. The room we had was very small but saying that it was cean and comfortable and suited our requirements perfectly. The staff were very helpful and friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “First time in a Travelodge.......”
Reviews.Author: GAZJK
Reviews.Content: Having been offered this by a relative at a knock down price, as a regular traveller to London was quite excited, until I read the mice report from a reviewer !! Keeping this from my wife I set off armed with trepidation and cheese !! After visiting two Travelodges before hitting the right one we were shown the room on the 5th floor very basic but clean, shower head wanted cleaning decor very tired flat screen tv remote never worked had to get off the bed to change channels how old fashioned !! But overall ok as a base for two nights - good breakfeast in a little cafe turn left and go up the hill !

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Hotel With A Few Snags”
Reviews.Author: LondonTripoli
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this London Travelodge nine times now; the rooms have always been clean and the towels and tea/coffee making facilities are always re-stocked. Be aware that if you stay at the front of the hotel there is road noise. However I always request a room to the rear now and they are much quieter. The Travelodge is just a 10/15 minute walk from Kings Cross station or just jump on a #63 bus outside of Kings Cross Station, there is a bus stop outside the Travelodge called Bus Stop 'Gwynne Place'. Be aware that you will pass another Travelodge on the same road. Breakfast is best bought outside locally, there is a wonderful cafe walking towards Kings Cross Station where you can get a huge English Breakfast with beverages for just 4.50. (You will see the blackboard outside of the cafe). The Eastern European staff are variable in quality. One time I complained about people smoking, they just shrugged their shoulders, which is disappointing. There is an internet terminal in the lobby: 1 pound for 20 minutes which is convenient. Fellow guests at the weekends can be noisy, so consider earplugs if you need a good-nights sleep. Don't forget to bring an alarm clock as there are no telephones in the rooms. Don't leave foodstuffs in your room as mice do inhabit the building. I once witnessed a small grey mouse one night searching my waste paper basket; I followed it and discovered that it comes in via the linoleum under the shower unit. If you don't like mice, then close the bathroom door before you sleep. Otherwise, I highly recommend this Travelodge, in my opinion it is better than the two others close by: Royal Scot and Kings Cross.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: towerridge
Reviews.Content: Its a basic Travelodge, and lots of the reviews here say this. The staff were friendly and helpful but I would go somewhere else next time. It is right on Kings Cross Road and the noise insulation is poor so the noise from the road kept me awake late and awoke me early. Also, despite booking 3 months in advance the best rate I could find was Â£60 ("it's London") , when I arrived they plastered the place with Travelodge's rooms for Â£19 adverts - that's just rubbing it in!

Reviews.Title: “For what you need it for. perfecly fine”
Reviews.Author: Habbitate
Reviews.Content: Lets face it, if your staying at a travel lodge its not going to be a romantic weekend with your loved one is it? It is what it is, a bed and a bathroom for the night, a base for a sight seeing trip or going to see a show or an event. Found it to be clean, comfortable and perfectly adequate for what we needed it for. check in was swift receptionist was warm and friendly, kindly booked us a taxi to where we were going that eveing as we didnt have a clue exactly where it was. bed, was two singled zipped together, but was comfy. Only think is maybe take an extra pillow as there was only one each. Bathroom was tiny and quite outdated but for what you need its fine. and ask for a room at the back, its quieter as it is on a busy road. basically it does exactly what it says on the tin...

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Stoneytony
Reviews.Content: I like Travelodge. Iâ€™ve stayed with them frequently because you know what to expect: reasonable service and a decent level of basic comfort in your room. This place is the exception that proves the rule. Itâ€™s the worst Lodge â€“ and possibly the worst hotel â€“ I have every stayed in. Another inmate described it to me as â€œa hovelâ€�, but I think she was being over-generous! After the most cursory of check-ins I found that one of the two lifts (the hotel has five floors and is busy) was out of order. It remained so throughout my midweek two night stay â€“ after all, lift engineers arenâ€™t easy to find in a small place like London. My room had a second floor number, but to get to it I had to go up two floors from reception, along a football pitch-length corridor, through a door, down a flight of dimly lit stairs, through another door and along another corridor. If youâ€™re allocated any of rooms 246 to 255 ask for a map! Incidentally, during my stay I saw at least three parties have to make their way all the way back to reception because their electronic key cards did not work first time round. The room was a reasonable size, adequately decorated with a double and a single bed. On switching on the lights I found that one of them was not working. (I mentioned this on my way out the following morning but the dead bulb was not replaced.) There was plenty of storage space for clothes, but one of the drawers was glued shut(!). I had specifically requested a double room (â€˜Double Room Plusâ€™, the booking details said) but found there was only one towel. To be fair, this was quickly resolved at reception. However, I then decided to take a shower before going out for dinner. In every other Travelodge I have stayed at I have been provided with basic toiletries. Not here: just a wafer-thin bar of soap, forcing me to dress again (okay, I should have checked) and walk to a corner shop two minutes away which seems to stock everything. Later, on going to bed, I found that my â€˜doubleâ€™ was in fact two single mattresses zipped together, covered by only a single sheet. That, and the fact that there was a gap of one foot (not an exaggeration) between the two base units made it distinctly uncomfortable lying in the middle of the bed. I then discovered another problem with the room. It overlooked Kingâ€™s Cross Road, which is busy with traffic 24 hours a day. The window was double-glazed, but it might as well have been a single sheet of rice paper for all the difference it made. Unless youâ€™re a really heavy sleeper demand a room at the rear of the hotel. If you really need low-budget accommodation in the Kingâ€™s Cross area youâ€™d do better to choose one of the B&Bs in the maze of streets between Woburn Place and Grayâ€™s Inn Road. If you want somewhere that provides the reasonable level of comfort and service you expect from a â€˜realâ€™ hotel, stay instead at the Holiday Inn across the road or the Ibis near Euston Station.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: Monkeylalala
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight. We spent very little time in the hotel, it was cheap and it had exactly what we needed - a comfortable bed, tea making facilities and a TV. Considering we were spending all day and evening out it was fine. We were at the back and the room was very quiet. It was also clean and although it was basic there were no problems at all with the accomodation. The only downside was that it was a bit of a walk from the main stations at King's Cross and St. Pancras. I found the staff friendly, helpful and efficient also the security was very good. The breakfast was excellent. I would use this hotel again, it's cheap and basic but it serves it's purpose completely.

Reviews.Title: “Grim rooms with burn marks on all the walls”
Reviews.Author: jumboflamingo
Reviews.Content: We were really dissapointed with this Travelodge - our room was definitely not up to their 'basic' standards. Each of the wall lights in the room had severe singing damage from using too bright bulbs. This had caused the walls to have burn marks all up them... it was not very reassuring going to sleep wondering if there were other electrical faults in the building... The breakfast was particularly frantic - with people wondering in having not paid and not being stopped by staff. The only coffee being served was from a machine using instant granules and UHT milk. Lots of items in the breakfast were running low/had run out, and no staff were on hand to replenish them. This wasn't good value for money as a couple of pounds extra would have got a much nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great or clean. breakfast was the best bit”
Reviews.Author: king123_18
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny for the price we paid and dusty, rusty, wonky etc. Broken items (e.g. toilet seat) one towel in room for two and on valentines weekend. Breakfast was nice, but only real positive about the hotel. Not too impressed, wont stay here again will pay for a better hotel nearer the centre of London

Reviews.Title: “Appalling value for money, dirty and depressing”
Reviews.Author: mazinmatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on very short notice. Here is the e-mail of complaint I have just sent to Travelodge: "I recently booked a room at the last minute for a one night stay in the London Farringdon Travelodge. I have several complaints about my stay: 1. When booking online, I accidentally selected one guest instead of two, meaning that when it came to pre-ordering breakfast and dinner it was only done for one person. I rang up the booking line to explain, but nobody could add another person for me as it was after noon on the day of the booking we booked at very short notice for the same day. I rang up the hotel too, and nobody would simply add another person for breakfast and dinner to my booking. This is the height of inflexibility - I understand that one cancel aspects of a booking after noon on the day of the visit, but there is absolutely no business logic behind not being able to add things. 2. When we arrived, we were put in room 123. The corridor reeked of smoke, as did the room. I went back to reception to explain, and we were helpfully moved to another room. However, I was told that "all your rooms are non-smoking". Either that is wrong, somebody is breaking the law, or you have not bothered to deep clean smoking rooms prior to marketing them as non-smoking rooms, which is unacceptable. 3. When eating dinner at the hotel restaurant, or two meals were served ten minutes apart, and to be frank the food was revolting, and gave both of us stomach upsets. The quality of the food was nicely summarised by the pot of BBQ sauce we were given which, when the plastic was peeled back, did not contain any sauce. 4. Although the room we were moved to did not smell of smoke, nearly all the surfaces were dirty, there were fittings on the side of the desk just hanging off, and every surface in the bathroom was rusty, - including the shower head, which is a health hazard. 5. At breakfast served in a room which was dark, dingy, and enclosed by windows which didn't look like they had been cleaned in months, I had to ask repeatedly for a mug for coffee. When the mugs arrived on a tray, the first one I picked up was filthy, covered in brown stains. I have photographic evidence should you be interested. I can assure you that we will not be staying in a Travlodge again if this is representative of your general quality of service."

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine - you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Snafflepants
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a cheap weekend as we were down watching some filming at the BBC. The rooms and the hotel are absolutely adequate - it was clean and the beds comfortable. Yes - it is worn out and needs a make over but for the price we paid - I have stayed in way worse B&B's for 2 or 3 times the price! The shower was great - very powerful! and the staff were fine - friendly and helpful enough. The hotel is situated on a busy road - we were on th roadside which is noisy but we slept no problem - probably worth asking for a room away from the road if you are a light sleeper. It is about a 10 minute walk to Kings Cross and Â£4 in a taxi. If you want luxury - then don't book here. But if you just want a place to crash and enjoy the city then it's fine and I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Only go if you want to experience HELL”
Reviews.Author: honestandfair9
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin... on arrival at about 8.30pm we were told they had double booked and so we no longer had a room and the hotel was full so if we didn't mind taking a seat in the bar area they'd see what we could do. (know we don't have much luck when booking into hotels so I could handle this). About 5-10 mins later we were told they'd found us a room so all was well and we headed up to get ready for a night on the town, Feeling upbeat I strolled into the room about to put my bag down when hello mate, the bed was strewn with clothes and the dressing table was covered with toilletries... yes you've guessed it, they'd given us someone else's room!!!!!!! So back down we went, to be honest rather annoyed by now. We were told to take a seat again but by now I was wanting something for this mess so my husband asked if we could have a drink from the bar while we waited. 'Of course' said the manager. So up to the bar my husband went only to return with the one single drink we were permitted, Were we epected to share the thing!!!!!!!!!!! So back to reception went my husband and horray the generosity of the establishment allowed us another drink. So now five minutes later we were presented with another room key and some towels because the room was only made up for one... later we found out why!!!!!!!!!! Up we went on the now very familiar elevator and enetered, would you believe it an empty room! YAY! No remote control but coule be worse. So first on my list list of jobs was a quick bath as time was now extremely short... we were gonna be late but not too late if we hurried. Just about to start filling the tub up when I looked down and saw a mass of hair littering the surface of the bath. Well I'm no snob but you're not getting me in their no matter how desperate I am. Phone call downstairs to ask for it to be cleaned (have you now worked out why the room was only made up for one......... yes because it hadn't been cleaned since the last occupier wooooopppppeeeeeee). Knock at the door... expecting a cleaner. No it;s the manager with a towel. Ok, in you come mister. He goes in, wipes the bath with the towel and leaves. Oh hooray henry! This is disgusting needless to say I change my mind about the bath. So I opt for a shower... on goes the water and........ no hot water!!!! That was it! Another phonecall dpwnstairs demanding something to be done. 'We have no other rooms but can transfer you to our branch in Tower Bridge, Now that would be ok if we weren't going out in the Farringdon area and weren't already considerably late. So sorry no that won't do. Here comes one of the only redeemable features of this whole stay... after strong words we managed to get our stay for free. Right stay for free now lets jsut get out of here. I go to wash my hair in the sink and find puke down the nearby tiles, oh the joy. Close the bathroom door and I can;t even explain what's on there. We give up hope, go out and have a reasonable night out... only hampered due to our now foul moods. Return rather jolly if you know what I mean and I have an urge for hot chocolate from the vending machine. Machine out of order but I can purchase a sachet to have in my room. Confirm with manager that there should be a kettle in our room. No kettle so my husband is asked by manager if he would pop downstairs with the cup to get some hot water. On return he tells me we've been given a free breakfast (2nd redeemable feature and last). Wake up and go to breakfast. They're out of plates and virtually all hot breakfast items so I end up eating toast out of a bowl. We leave.... end of visit. What I hope you have gained from reading this is that 1 I have an amazing husband and 2 no matter how cheap you can get a room here... don't do it!!!!!!!!!! (we paid Â£89 btw)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For Money and Will definitly Return”
Reviews.Author: OliverHampshire
Reviews.Content: Service was first class, Manager very hepful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble Good Breakfast, reasonably priced. Rooms basic but clean and comfortable. Easily reached from Kings Cross Station..

Reviews.Title: “not a great experience but not that bad either”
Reviews.Author: barryfromkent
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in lots of travellodges but its fair to say that this on lets the company down.It basically shabby but i disagree with earlier comments about the staff .They were very helpfull and the noise was not that bad. (my room looked on to the main road) It is clean but I am not sure i would want to stay there out of choice as it is in the middle of the kings cross an area well known for drug dealing and prostitution.Having said that I stayed there 2 nights and never so any problems at all. But if I were on holiday my advice is there are much better parts of London to stay. I complained to the manager about the shower head being rusty The manager was very helpfull and apoligetic telling me what steps he was taking to address the issue-Would i recomend it ? As someone who knows London the answer is no-Visitors should expect much better than this and this is quite a disapointment for travelodge reputation

Reviews.Title: “Great value, central location rooms cosy and comfortable - traffic noise”
Reviews.Author: teamcommander
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews expected the worse - was pleasantly surprised. We had a two triple rooms looking out onto Kings Cross Rd. The room was lovely and warm - heated with radiators rather than air con unit. Three real beds as opposed to the usual roll-away bed. Enjoyed watching the world go by though by night there was traffic noise - but you'd expect that on such a main road - slept well. Some black mould on ceiling in bathroom - but all fitments, floors etc spotlessly clean. Breakfast - bacon and sauasage good quality, but no eggs due to prob with supplier and beans and tomatoes cold - fruit salad not appetising - so not a good breakfast for vegetarians. Overall very pleased with the hotel - have paid Â£85 for a room no better than this in Shrewsbury!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the other reviews sounded.”
Reviews.Author: together_serena
Reviews.Content: I traveled with 2 other friends and got a family room facing the main road for 3 nights. It was rather quiet throughout the entire stay (might be due to the festive season), and not like what the other reviews said about the noise pollution from the roads. The room is clean and tidy, with a tad of rustiness in certain areas (like the shower-head, and burn lamp shades). The flat screen television made the room appear to be a little more modernised. The heater is a rather old-fashioned ones with a knob (can't really see the writing) to adjust the temperature. However the temperature in the room is just right most of the time , perhaps some hours of the stay it was a little colder (just have to go under the blankets). The toilet is small, yet included a bath tub. Clean look and sufficient moving space for 1 person. Too cramp if 2 people wants to brush their teeth at the same time. Accessibility via the underground tube is not the more ideal, but definitely within walking distance. Just make sure that you come out from the Pentonville Road exit from King's Cross Station. All in all, a good experience staying in Travelodge. Will recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Effiehants
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel as going to a friend's engagement party in London. Having booked the hotel I looked on trip advisor and wished I hadn't as the majority of reviews were very negative! I even tried to find an alternative hotel! However, i have just returned from my stay and have to say I was pleasantly surprised and very relieved! The rooms were tired and dated but were clean and the location was great for our time in London - only a few minutes walk from Kings Cross. Had a perfect night sleep and wouldn't have any concerns about staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “OMG - only if your on a tight budget!!”
Reviews.Author: TBF28
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night - thankfully!! Reception staff - v busy - just going thru motions - no pleasantries Room - tiny with hideous bathroom - mould on walls - very rusty shower rail - burn marks in lampshades Noise - dreadful with some sort of pump going off every 45 seconds!! Breakfast - just about worth the money but nothing to write home about Location - OK 10 mins walk to Kings Cross Overall a very tired tatty hotel which you should use only if your on a tight budget as my Company is at present and staying for a very short period of time - having said that it's still nearly Â£100 a night!!

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasantly surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: latay26
Reviews.Content: To be honest I was really worried when I read the reviews on here after I booked to stay two nights at the London Farringdon, however I was pleasantly surprised. Check in was quick even though it was really busy and the staff were polite and accommodating, I had a single room that I requested at the back of the hotel, it was very clean, cosy and comfortable, if a little dated, but that wasnt a problem to me as it was well maintained. There were plenty tea and coffee supplies in the room which were topped up daily and a nice flat screen TV, plenty of seating and wardrobe space for a single room. The bathroom was also very clean with constant hot water and a nice powerful shower. I slept soundly both nights in a very comfortable bed. Breakfast was very nice with plenty of choice, served in a clean dining room. I honestly cant fault this hotel, I agree the decor is a little dated but its not dirty as some reviews state, it is very comfortable, clean and cheap! Its also very close to central London which in itself is a huge bonus. I have used Travelodge a lot and I would definately return to the London Farringdon and recommend it to others. My advice would be dont believe everything you read, ask for a room at the back away from the lifts and as long as you arent expecting a Marriott type hotel you will be very comfortable here

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST EVER”
Reviews.Author: REDLEADER2000
Reviews.Content: The noise was one thing but the fact the window didnt close and then let the rain in was even worse. The double bed was two singles pushed together without a method of securing them and topped with what i can only decribe as two cloth covered joined up springs. I have suggested that the hotel state that they offer room 323 as a contraceptive room as the beds come apart at the mere thought of pleasure! Come on Travel Lodge I know you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “It could be better but still fairly good value considering location”
Reviews.Author: harveypips
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed here after realising how handy it is for getting into central London, however I have to say the room did seem a little more shabby than last year but it is cheaper than the other 2 nearby Travelodges. I wouldn't really like to stay for more than a night here but if the other Travelodges were full I think we would still return here admittedly it wouldn't be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Crazy_Manc_Girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights as part of a cheap few days in London. I agree the rooms were very hot but we coped. We had a family room (double and single) which could be changed into a triple. The breakfast was fine and there was a great selection to choose from. They were a bit slow to replenish the breakfast that had been taken but it eventually came. We travelled into Euston and took the long way to the hotel. But if you get the tube to King's Cross and then the #63 bus - this stops straight outside the hotel. Didn't really go out in the area of the hotel but it looked OK. We had a meal one night in the hotel which was good value. One thing I would ask for is a room away from the main road as it can be noisey. The bathroom was small but it done what we needed it to do. The shower was very powerful which was a great wake-up in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Bit Depressing”
Reviews.Author: margarita742
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay here for a cheap weekend away in London for a event. As I was going alone most hotels charge double for single rooms so chose to stay here as I have stayed in a few in Manchester and they were basic yes but the decor was ok and fine to stay in for a few nights. I paid Â£95 for 2 nights which was reasonable. I booked online and requested a double room as I can't stand single beds! However on checking in I had been given a single room and wow how small! I can say I have never been in Prison but I bet actual Prison cells were nicer! I think the actual walls were the problem I cannot think what the exact term is but instead of having a smooth finish on the walls and ceiling they were all bumpy plaster which made the room look even smaller if that was possible. Lumpy bed too but it was clean. I suppose I had expected better as the ones I have stayed at in Manchester were actually quite nice but this obviously hadn't been decorated for a while Main reason apart from price for choosing here was for the closeness to Kings Cross it was about a 5/10 minute walk though with a heavy suitcase seemed a lot longer! I was exhausted after being up since 4am and not being able to check in til 3pm I seen a Travelodge at the end of what seemed a very long road but it was Kings Scot Travelodge, however Farringdon is literally a minute away which I thought was odd Anyway I would probably not reccomend staying here but if you're not spending much time in your room and want a cheap price then it's ok but don't expect much.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing: Shabby, damp rooms”
Reviews.Author: mungogubbins
Reviews.Content: 3 single rooms, all with damp in bathrooms. The decor was depressing and shabby-mouldy shower curtains topped off the accommodation. Breakfast was cold and limited- Walk up to Roseberry Avenue and get a breakfast at one of the cafes there. Have stayed in many travel lodges and this is not to their basic but acceptable standard. Reception staff were friendly but that's the only positive.

Reviews.Title: “Its not as bad as everyone says!!!! Basic but it does the job!”
Reviews.Author: Suz1984
Reviews.Content: I was so nervous about staying here after reading all the bad reviews,,, but we'd booked it months ago and already paid so we gave it a go! Its not as bad as everyone says!! Their is a car park at the back which charges Â£15 for 24 hours which is cheap compared to the NCP carparks!! The staff were friendly and our room was basic (apart from the flatscreen tv!!) but it was clean.. what more do you want when youre staying in central London for Â£40 a night?!?! We only had one problem, and that was we were staying next to some very noisy girls who were running up the halls from 2am-6am (not good when we were running half marathons the next day!) but the staff were nice enough and said on our next stay to ask to stay in the 'alcove' as this was a quiet part of the hotel. Its only 15 mins walk from St Pauls cathedral, and we spent the rest of our stay sightseeing,and enjoying madame tussauds,,,, overall,,, give this hotel a go! its not as bad as everyone says and its a bargain for staying in central London!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “So noisy I couldn't sleep”
Reviews.Author: Haggerdoo
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in many travelodges over the years for business and most have been fine - basic, functional and reasonable value. However my recent stay at the Farringdon Travelodge was an absolute nightmare - stayed in a single room No 110. The guy at reception said the room was at the back of the hotel so less noisy - I wish! There must have been some airconditioning unit or something outside my window - there was a constant droning noise which prevented me from getting little more than a couple hours sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Prisoner Cell Block Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: winter-st*r
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many Travelodges, and they serve and purpose, you get what you pay for etc etc, but none has been so grim as this one. We booked just for one night to go to a concert in Royal Festival Hall and I wanted to keep the cost down so this was the cheapest Travelodge room within a reasonable distance to the venue. I totally forgot to check this site before I booked! Check in time was 3pm but we arrived in London earlier and wanted to leave our stuff and head off to Tate Modern, then dinner and come back after the concert, so we went straight to the hotel. Â£10 early check in fee. Kerching! Room was like a prison cell. Bathroom was crumbling. Our room had a double bed and a single. I found 50p on the floor near the bed, which didn't look good for the quaility of the vacuuming done to the room before we arrived. It was all just grim grim grim. It just needs updating - a lot! The room was boiling hot but if you open the window the traffic noise is deafening, so we used the electric fan supplied (filthy) which squeaked, but no option as too hot to sleep without it. I couldn't stay in this hotel if I was on a business trip on my own and having to stay in the room, TV or no TV (the TV was a nice new one - the only thing in room post 1985)! So depressing. Miserable, musty, minging!! Worst Traveldoge ever. This won't put me off Travelodge as got a few bargains for Â£12 coming up, but I will check Tripadviser in future for the London ones as there are so many, they can't all be this dire, in fact I know they're not.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe your booking confirmation”
Reviews.Author: libras
Reviews.Content: Despite booking and paying in advance and then phoning ahead to double check that the booking was confirmed the room was still let to someone else. The desk staff said that it's the policy of the company to keep taking bookings for a popular hotel even if they are fully booked and they send the overspill (that's us customers that get there later in the day) to any old vacant room around Greater London. In this case, we ended up in the Battersea Travelodge (a pretty awful hotel but possibly less grim than the Farringdon branch judging by the reviews here). I've learnt my lesson and wont be using Travelodge in London again.

Reviews.Title: “A blast from the past, and not in a good way”
Reviews.Author: twogaijins
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 nights at the Travelodge London Farringdon as it was in the Kings Cross area but was cheaper than the other two Travelodges in the area. What a mistake. I checked out after 1 night. The hotel resembles a converted office block, but inside the rooms looks like it was a 1950s hotel, with these fittings and fixtures. The hotel has been given a lick of paint, but everywhere you turn looks tatty. The beds were springly, the rooms had no air conditioning and was on a noisy road (earplugs advisable). The TVs have been updated to flat screens (not widescreen) but there is still a comical wired-in 'remote control' on the wall beside the bed which controlled the old TV. There was no fridge in the room which meant constant trips to the corner shop to get cold water to deal with the oven-like temperatures in the room. The bathroom has an always-on heated towel rail which doesn't help with the lack of aircon. There's always the mini desk fan that they provide to take the edge off, but personally I found it useless. One of the towels in the bathroom was dirty, but thankfully there was a spare for this sole traveller, and I avoided showering more than once. There was only a small bar of generic soap in the bathroom so bring your own toiletries if you do have to stay here. Staff were nice enough but looked like they really didn't want to be there, and who could blame them. I certainly won't be back, and feel like this property has scares me off of staying at any other Travelodge, even although some have been ok in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Mouse in Room”
Reviews.Author: hal52
Reviews.Content: Room needed up dating but quiet happy with price and location , BIG PROBLEM LAST NIGHT OF STAY . Watching TV about 11.00pm , Mouse popped out from under the bed , as i tried to explain to my wife what i had seen it popped out again from under the other bed . Went down to reception , the duty manager did not bad an eye lid , relocated us to another floor and gave us a refund for the night , wife in trauma , i would rather have slept in the train station , don't think i will sleep tonight . The funny thing was as we were waiting to make our complaint the night duty clerk was refusing bookings for the night , but as soon as we had a problem there was a room available , which turned out to be a room with three single beds , is this the room they keep when the mouse is loose in the hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Smelly, Dirty & Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: BouchUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 424, right on the street and as previous people have mentioned, there is traffic going past 24/7. Even when the window is shut noise can still be heard. We stayed for 2 nights and the 2nd night we had the fan on all night and didnt even get in the covers because it was that hot and with the window open the traffic was too noisy ( even with it shut traffic could still be heard) The bathroom smelt and there was mould all over the ceilings, the towels smelt horrible too, after you had showered there was a horrible smell on your skin. There was a lamp shade with a hole burnt into it from the bulb, you would think this is a standard thing that would be checked and repaired. The bed was 2 singles pushed together to make a double and when you laid down your feet were higher than your head as it was sloped down so much! We came to London to celebrate my partners birthday and there is no way I would ever book this travelodge,and it has put me off booking other travelodges. We paid Â£200 for 2 nights including breakfast, the room was not worth Â£40 / night. Location wise its about a 10 mintue walk from Kings Cross Station, not too bad but I rang the travelodge for directions and was told " I dont know road names, get on a number 63 bus" which was no help at all! Overall, I would advise people to stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Phew it was hot!”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth_Youde
Reviews.Content: We too have just stayed in this Travelodge and yes the rooms were hot (though we had a plug in fan!). The hotel is good and conveniently located about 10 minutes walk from King' Cross. Good restaurant (recommend the steak and ale pie!). On the walk to it you pass the King's Cross Travelodge which was always busy with coachloads of foreign tourists. We could see huge queues for breakfast in the morning. Don't buy breakfast in the hotel. Instead on the walk to King's Cross station you pass cafes with boards outside doing full English. We had one for Â£3.80. It included a pile of toast, hot drink and even chips! We were lucky, we got the Â£9 per night per room Travelodge deal off the internet site which comes up every so often. So our 3 nights cost Â£27!!!!!!!! By the way, we also travelled from Preston to London on the Megabus for Â£2 return each. So, all in all a bargain holiday. We also got 2 for 1 into Hampton Court Palace and gardens with a day Travelcard. I have details if interested.

Reviews.Title: “Sauna like room”
Reviews.Author: Mackem1
Reviews.Content: This is a largeish Travelodge with a breakfast facility in the building unlike some Like all Travelodges it does what it says on the tin, though my room was a good size, and the room had a hosptiality tray and tv, and a dencent bathroom with shower over the bath Whilst i didnt require many services from the staff, the reception staff at check in and check out were friendly and helpful My main memory of the place though was it was the hottest room i have ever stayed in though the radiators werent on, and this want helped by a window which wouldnt open or close properly being open a tiny bit but without opening wider Has i stayed in winter the place would have been fine and i shandy for the Russell Square and Kings Cross areas

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: bubwal
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of The Travelodge and have said in many across the country, particularly across central London. However the Travelodge at Farringdon is extremely tired and the rooms are in drastic need of updating to the standard of new Travelodge's in the area such as King's Cross. It was also too hot in the rooms but you could not keep the window open at night as the road on the front is too noisy. Try to request a room at the back. Overall it was clean and fine for one night but I would not stay at Farringdon again

Reviews.Title: “adequate stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: maryNorthLincs
Reviews.Content: after reading reviews on this travelodge i was wary about what i would find when we arrived. we found it perfectly good, clean rooms, staff were friendly and helpful. there was plenty of choice at breakfast. the street was a bit noisy( but what do you expect in the centre of london). as we were only staying one night en route to paris , it was perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value for money - am confused at all the complaints!”
Reviews.Author: alexular
Reviews.Content: We paid Â£9 for a double room for one night, booked in advance online. To begin with, the hotel is NOT 20 minutes from a tube station. It is 5 mins walk from Kings X, just a little further up the road than the Kings X Royal Scot Travelodge. We checked in with no issues at 3pm (am confused at the complaints over the Â£10 early check-in fee - this is standard Travelodge policy). It's true, not all of the reception staff speak English as a first language - but most of them are bilingual and this is to keep up with their business needs! We were in a room on the second floor, but actually found when we got there, it was seperated away from the rest of the hotel. This was ideal for us, and when we opened the door, found easily the biggest Travelodge room I have ever stayed in - which was impressive! Everything in the room was clean and worked. We could hear some Underground noise, but only with the window open. Extremely good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Lodge Kings Cross Farringdon Road......not much better than a doss house”
Reviews.Author: blackfive
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune to have an overnight stay here recently.Firstly I may say there are 3 Travel Lodges around Kings Cross and this one is furthest from the station.It is about a 15 min walk away.The street that it is in is not very nice at all.You would not want to walk out here late at night. The room was of a low standard which I must say is not of the usual for Travel Lodges which I find to be fine for their money.The lamp shades were burnt of the heat from the bulbs.The room smelt a bit.The bathrooom was dingy and the shower was all black with fungus.I did not sleep in the bed in fear of catching something unwanted .When it was time to catch the first train North from Kings Cross I beat my retreat.Had a quick shave and was off. On leaving I noticed a kind of doss house down the road as there seemed to be a lot of hoodie types congregating outside it.This hotel also was not much better than a doss house.Be warned stay clear.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, dated and mile away from nearest tube”
Reviews.Author: Bearable1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many travelodges and this is the worst by far. The lodge looks like it was converted from an old hotel. The location is poor, at least 20 minutes from the nearest tube station. The room was dirty, the carpet unhoovered, the beds past their sell by dates, but it was the bathrooms that made us sick. If you like showered in other peoples public hairs, this is the place for you. The ceiling was covered in black mould, the shower head covered in red mould, and mounds of dirt in every nook at cranny of the bathroom. There was even a used toothpick left on the sink when we arrived, which we refused to pick up and remained there during our 3 day stay. Just stay away from here, it is horrible.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: LondonWolly
Reviews.Content: stayed in other travelogde before and yes, you get what you pay for. Staff could be a bit more nicer and friendly. Some did not speak proper English, shame. Very good location, close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Scruffy, Rude, Unorganised!”
Reviews.Author: Giz89
Reviews.Content: I booked a family room for mysel and my Mum for a leisure trip for one night ( 12th june), we arrived at half 1 (check in wasnt until 3) but if paid an extra tenner we could check in early (sure the money went into the receptionists back pocket!) the man at the check in desk was VERY rude, no please, thank you's, when we arrived to our room the card key wouldnt register, cleaner had to let us in! The room was unbearably hot, the bathroom was smelly...and ill agree with the above comment, yes i was itchy in the beds!!!...we arrived back from our trip at 22:55 and at frist was refused drinks at the bar as it closed at 23:00, after pointing out the time was finally served! when we arrived to our room again the key card wouldnt work, so i went down to reception where he re- programmed it, and I was "advised" to keep the card away from Metal and electrical objects as it will cancel out the card? (wtf?) finally got into our room, description was "some exterior noise" rubbish, the street was INCREDIBLY noisy even with the window closed! The following morning- x2 lights didnt work, x1 plug socket didnt work the other was dangerously faulty! the lamp shades were black from being burnt by the light bulbs!...Breakfast bar was a complete shambles! not enough seating, no cutlery, no plates, drinks machine leaking everywhere....i can only compliment one member off staff who seemed to be the only one doing his job. overall i found the hotel a complete dissapointment and for an extra Â£20-Â£30 i could of stayed at a premier inn..nearer to an underground too. i WOULD NOT advise this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Really Grim Place”
Reviews.Author: bec026Midlands
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed here on the 6th June, i had booked it a few months in advance so paid Â£49 for the room. I had looked on tripadvisor before we arrived so was not expecting a lot from this hotel. When we arrived the hotel from the outside looked pretty grim. We checked in ok and when we got to our room, the room was dirty and the shower didn't work, so we trekked back down to reception and told them. They did not seem surprised at all and quickly gave us a different room . In the 2nd room the window didn't open and the heat in the room was stifling, also the shower worked this time but there was no hot water. So back down to reception again, the 3rd room we had was marginally better but at least the window opened a bit and the shower was warm. The room was so old and the bathroom was pretty disgusting - we were only staying for one night though and we were hardly in the room only to sleep so we didn't just to put up with it. I don't know if it was my imagination but i was itching all night and still am today - 2 days afterwards. I would seriously not recommend this hotel to anyone, spend 20 quid extra and actually get a cleaner nicer room. Yuk.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute dump!”
Reviews.Author: Englischer
Reviews.Content: As a regular user of T/Ls I am very used to varying standards, but this place is awful. The only thing going for it is it's proximity to Kings Cross buses/tube. I normally try and book a family room for the extra space and sofa; this T/L has one, room 439 at the far end nearest Kings Cross of the front side of the hotel. We ended up there twice before and after our holiday. There are two singles joined together to make a large double, plus a full size single bed (no sofa here) crammed in to a normal size room. The double is 4 inches from the main heating radiator which has a constantly hot, water feed to the top where the control valve is, so even in the recent hot weather you still get heat! The old worn out UPVC windows will not lock shut, so you cannot keep the street noise (of which there is quite a lot at weekends) out. The area above the window and the net curtains are black at the top! I could go on, but I am sure people will get the message....................... Oh, and taking 3 noisy unbooked men with 2 girls in off the street at 4am (Iwas Internetting in the lobby as I could not sleep) with no luggage leaves a huge question in my mind about the standard and sensibility of the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap rooms!”
Reviews.Author: lincolnshireposy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to find and within walking distance of Kings X - probably about 10-15 minutes brisk walk. We tried a couple of routes and thought the best was - take Gray's Inn Road opposite KX, walk down to Acton Street (past another Lodge). Turn left down Acton Street and right at the end onto King's X Rd. The Lodge is a couple of minutes walk just around the bend on the left. Our room was a reasonable size for London, made smaller by the horrid woodchip effect wallpaper which made the walls feel like they were closing in. We had a double plus (double + single)which meant that if you are a party of 3 you all have a proper bed. The room was clean and well appointed for budget with small bath and shower. The basin taps didn't work properly. This was clearly a room in dire need of an update, but as we were on a saver rate we may have been allocated it. Hopefully, the flexible rate rooms are more recently re-furbished. The road was noisy - no escaping that if it bothers you. I was a bit worried that all the fire doors seemed to be propped open. Overall, great value on the cheap rate if you just want somewhere to sleep. I wouldn't be happy if I'd paid more than Â£50.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms near Kings Cross, Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: limerickonline
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located approximately 10/15 minute walk from London Kings Cross station, or you can catch the number 63 bus from the front of KGX station directly to the door of the hotel. (Bus fares are Â£2 single, or if you buy a oyster card from the underground travel centre, bus fares are only 50p - a big saving) The hotel is clean and the majority of staff were friendly. Although the rooms were small, they were clean and comfy. As expected in the Travelodge no ammenities are provided, but it was stated that if you did require any toiletries, these would be provided free of charge. Internet is available from reception and is a coin operated computer. A restaurant is located in the main lobby and offers a good breakfast which can be booked online or at reception for Â£7.50. We enjoyed breakfast every morning, the food was hot and there was a wide selection. However we had a bad encounter with the evening restaurant. The hotel offers a 'bar style food'. It was very busy. It took 45 minutes for them to take the order and a further 45 to get the food. They apologised for the delay and said it was due to ho busy they were and they only had one chef. The food on arrival was very 'ready meal'. Frozen fish and frozen chips, classical microwave meal type taste and appearance. For the price, I do not think it was worth it. Overall, for the price, it was a good hotel to stay in, however I would not like to pay the full room rate price to stay there. No problems, cheap and clean in true Travelodge style.

Reviews.Title: “'Not in this lifetime!'”
Reviews.Author: DMSGlasgow
Reviews.Content: On entering my hostel type room, I was met with an array of man sized toe nail clippings on the floor. Despite asking for this to be cleaned up, this didn't happen. The old, soggy soap and hair in the bathroom was disgusting and the cleanliness of the restaurant area wasn't much better.

Reviews.Title: “Hot Value! - better in the winter?”
Reviews.Author: Jezaroo
Reviews.Content: Great service received, all staff polite and friendly. Rooms a bit dated but clean and tidy. Only thing is this hotel has no air conditioning, and our room was very hot. Window opened a little, but then we could hear the traffic. They do supply fans, but don't really do anything

Reviews.Title: “Shabby,dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: familyx5
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many travel lodges over the years and all the london ones i have visited have been small and pokey,but in central London you get what you pay for i know,BUT this hotel is nasty.The rooms are unclean,the beds are horrible and the sheets were scratchy and horrid.The duvet was as thin as paper and i have come away with bites on my face and back.I spent all night itching.Horribe horrible horrible.The staff need a rocked up their backside and a smile on their miserable faces,or maybe they have to sleep in this flea pit too. What also annoyed me was a bare faced lie i was told by recpetion when i rang to book some months ago.I askled if the Farringdon was the closest travel lodge to the tube station or was the Royal Scott closer,to which i was told that the Farringdon could be viewed from the station and was a 2min walk and the closest one.Lie! Royal scott is the first travel lodge along that road and even that is after a ten min walk.Farringdon is another 5-10 mins from that hotel. Top tip, dont bother coming here.

Reviews.Title: “A good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cadbury-the-hamster
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in walking distance of King's Cross and cheap for the centre of London. The all you could eat breakfast was great. The room was a good size, and the staff were friendly. The only real problem was the shower did not get very hot, as we only stayed the one night we told the receptionist on our departure! Also ocnsidering the hotel is on a busy road, there really was not alot of noise. I would recommend it to anyone, a very good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “BUDGET ACCOMMODATION AND A GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: sportsfan61
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel in a great location. 5 Mins walking to Kings Cross station and then 2 stops from the Emirate Stadium. This location is a favourtie for travelling Arsenal fans. On arrival the reception staff were busy but courteous, friendly and very helpful. The rooms are basic with adequate facilities. This hotel is a good value budget hotel so don't expect more when you book. Good luck and enjoy London.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and ,while I had hot water, many others were loudly complaining they didn't.”
Reviews.Author: tcyokohama
Reviews.Content: If you can get a Travelodge special deal this is an OK place to stay - as long as you are used to hostel type room conditions. It took me 30 minutes to wrench open the jammed hot water tap in the evening; at one point I was ready to give up and have a morning shower but luckily I didn't. As I checked out I heard three separate rooms complaining they had no hot water in the morning. Found the rooms slightly grimy and the double-bed was two singles of slightly differing heights pushed together. Got my earplugs ready as I was concerned about the noise from the main road but it wasn't too bad so didn't need them. It's about a 12 minute walk from the Kings Cross station - was good for me to catch a Eurostar train, as well as a train to Gatwick AIrport. I also stayed at the other Kings Cross Travelodge, a little closer to Kings Cross station and situated on the same road, a month later. Farringdon is much smaller and therefore quieter as it doesn't get the large school groups. Farringdon Travelodge is only another 3 to 5 minutes walk from the station.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Room in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: StroudSarah
Reviews.Content: The room was the usual for a travel lodge and had all you need for a base and as I got the room for Â£29 it wasn't bad. Easy to get into London on foot or by tube. The bathroom is in need of a refurbishment as tiles are cracked and ceiling mouldy. The room was noisy at night due to traffic, but its states this in the information. Wouldn't recommend buying evening meals in advance as many of these were cheaper anyway. Meals tended to be shove in the oven convenience food.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay at this one again”
Reviews.Author: Humphman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in several Travelodges in London and this is the worst of the lot. On the website it said you could get some noise from the road outside, what it did not say was that it sounds like a war zone. The windows were taped up with sellotape and the bath was falling apart. Fortunately I got a Â£19 deal so I put up with it, but others in London are way better for the same price. It's about a 10 minute walk from Kings Cross station so if you've got big bags you need a cab to get there. Won't ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap place to sleep but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: STSAVER
Reviews.Content: As the saying goes "you get what you pay for". This Travelodge can often be booked for the cheaper rates, which is for a reason. It's a basic Travelodge, with average rooms, noise from road out front, staff that do the bare minimum and little else. Despite comments about it being in a dangerous area it is not the case. You can walk from Kings Cross station in 10-15 minutes and despite it not being the nicest of areas its no more dangerous that other areas of London, so its ideal if you want a cheap basic place to do nothing other than sleep. If you have the option then I would go for the Kings Cross Travelodge before this one, then the Royal Scot Travelodge as both slightly closer to Kings Cross and in better condition.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - great price!”
Reviews.Author: shugspice
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a cheap weekend break, and for the Â£19 we paid for one nightâ€™s stay, it was a great bargain! This Travelodge was slightly different to many others we have stayed in outside town centres â€“ it was larger (about 5 floors), and had an excellent cafe/bar area serving drinks, snacks, breakfasts, lunches and dinners. Our room was on the top floor at the front of the hotel. As it was located along a busy road there was some traffic noise, but this wasnâ€™t a big problem for us (there is also a notice about this when booking on the hotel website). The room was similar to other Travelodges â€“ basic, clean and comfortable, but one difference was the flat screen television which was a nice surprise! The bathroom was small but perfectly adequate for a short stay. The hotel is about 15 minutesâ€™ walk from Kings Cross station. We noticed another similar-looking Travelodge only a few minutes away walk from this one (Kings Cross Royal Scot), which confused us slightly! Russell Square, the British Museum and the various restaurants in Southampton Row are about a 20-25 minute walk away. It is possible to walk to Oxford Street and the sights of central London, although this is a longer walk. For a Friday night stay in a central London hotel, we thought this Travelodge was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than we expected.”
Reviews.Author: bunnywunny1
Reviews.Content: We booked this Travelodge as we know the area and it was only Â£19.00 per night, also not far to walk from Kings Cross. We were given a warm welcome when we checked in and the room we were given was as on the second floor facing the road, which was noisy ( they state this on their web site) at times but as we were always out and about it did not bother us. The bed was comfy and had clean crisp white bed linen. Soap, two towels, tea, coffee, electric fan, tv. The carpet was clean and the artex was clean!!! (it would take forever to referb that). I would not like to pay the top price for this type of room but for the price we were happy with a clean room and a place to rest our heads at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Old Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: CroomstyxKent
Reviews.Content: This is a really shabby Travelodge that has seen far better days. It was just about OK for the Â£9 I paid but I would not go there again unless no other option. It's just in need of a total make-over and its location near Kings Cross station doesn't help. Check in was fine, the glass of wine from the bar was fine, the room was shabby, the bathroom was grotty and the shower did not work at all. There are better Travelodges to stay at in safer locations.

Reviews.Title: “It does the job I suppose”
Reviews.Author: jeffm1971
Reviews.Content: I've used Travelodge quite a few times and found there hotels to be satisfactory, But the Faringdon hotel does let the side down. It was a clean and comfortable hotel, but the bedrooms are in very serious need of a refurb, I dont think my room was decorated since the early 80's and artex covered walls dont appeal to me whatsoever, plus one of the wall lamps had a serious burn mark and the bathroom was so tiny that you couldn't swing a cat in it But for Â£19 for the night, I shouldn't moan too much but I would have been upset if it cost more.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: travellodger
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a stop off to our disneyland holiday and i seriously wouldnt recomend it to anyone. Me and my partner arrived with our young child asleep in a pushchair, 2 large suitcases and we both had sprained ankles. We checked in and was told we were on the top floor, the lifts weren't working and we had to make our own way to our room as staff were unwilling to help.Our room was dirty, we had a cracked toilet seat, a mouldy shower curtain and a jammed window.The smoke alarm was also hanging off the ceiling. We asked for information about London and was told to ask elsewhere as the staff could barely speak English. They were rude and ignorant. We didnt expect much from a travelodge but we did expect better customer service than we got. We have since stayed in other travelodges and had some pleasant experiences but I wouldnt recomend this 1 to even the homeless.

Reviews.Title: “Sraightforward hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Dirk49
Reviews.Content: This straightforwrd, no frills Travelodge was showing some signs of wear but it did exactly what it claimed - providing low cost accomodation handy for St Pancras International and in a lively area full of bars and restaurants. The road outside was quite noisey despite double glazing but we were quite staified.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price but is due a lick of paint”
Reviews.Author: alit
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd stay here in 2 years. I knew what to expect, the Â£29 rate is worth it but I would not pay more for this Travelodge until it has been refurbished now. I arrived at 5pm and check in was swift, having stayed before I asked for a quieter room at the back of the hotel and was given room 407. This had a large double bed, which was clean and comfy. The rooms are dated - will be fine once they have a refit and get rid of the 1980's tatty brown furniture! Usual flatscreen tv/kettle/carpark view and window that opens 1/2 inch so it was a bit stuffy. I would hate to stay there in hot weather! The bathroom was dated too but ok, not the best of power showers but plenty of towels. I slept well but it was quiet on the bookings that weekend. Staff were friendly booking a taxi for us, I used the bar but not the breakfast as Im vegan so not worth the price for the few items I might be able to eat. There is a grotty corner shop next door for bottled water grotty as not very clean but ok for drinks. Kings Cross is a 10 minute walk away or the 63 bus is every 10 mins. I walked from the British Museum in 15-20 mins. My friend commented the parking bays are a tight squeeze and there have been problems with cars being clamped there, people did get their money back from Travelodge dont know the details but Id check about parking on arrival with reception staff. I prefere other Travelodges but this one is fine on the saver rate, do ask for a room at the back though and the rooms will be stuffy. This Travelodge does get more negative reviews but Ive stayed 3 times now with no problems. Yes Its dated but on the Â£29 or less rate Its ok for a cheap break.

Reviews.Title: “What do people expect for Â£26 a night in London?!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yeboah75
Reviews.Content: Okay, so it wasn't the Hilton, but I don't think you can really grumble for a hotel that is a 20 minute walk from St Paul's Cathedral for Â£26 per night. The bathroom was very small and pretty grotty and you may get woken up by the traffic on King's Cross Road at the front of the hotel or the vibrations from the underground trains at the back, but ask yourself what you are looking for out of your stay? If you need a base that is pretty central and incredibly cheap then I don't think you can go far wrong here. The Farringdon underground station is a 10 minute walk away, there are plentiful bars and places to eat very close by and, if you are arriving by train at Kings Cross, it is only a 15 minute walk to the hotel, meaning you don't have the hassle of taking your luggage on the underground. If you are after comfort and a romantic break then stay elsewhere. If you want a relatively central place to sleep after a day of sightseeing and a few drinks, then this place is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice sized room but too hot and noisy”
Reviews.Author: sexyc1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night in July. It's about a 15 minute walk from London Kings Cross Station. Turn left out of the station onto Pentonville Road, then the 2nd right onto Kings Cross Road. There are actually 2 Travelodges on Kings Cross Road. The Farringdon branch is the 2nd travelodge you come to, opposite the Holiday Inn. The hotel itself is ok. However, we stayed in room 535. Avoid it at all costs. The window would not shut properly and the noise outside was unbearable. We had about 2 hours sleep in total. Also, the room was too hot. They had supplied us with a fan which only had 2 settings, mild and medium, which did nothing to cool us down. I would stay again at the hotel but not in the same room. For Â£29 you pay for what you get. We didn't stay for breakfast as we had to catch a 7am train. Staff were friendly and tried to help as much as they could.

Reviews.Title: “OK!”
Reviews.Author: CelticFire
Reviews.Content: Got this for Â£29 so that puts it in context. The area is ok. For Central London the price was great so if that's your philosophy its fine. The room was again ok. A bit tired and shabby, but how long do you spend in the room. I wouldn't book it for a Holiday, but for a cheap overnight it served the purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the rest of you say!”
Reviews.Author: Me180
Reviews.Content: After reading some blatently awful reviews about this Travelodge I began to worry about what I had paid for! When we arrived it looked a bit dingy from the outside but what do you expect for a budget rate hotel just outside of central London? When we went inside I was pleasently suprised it was nice and clean and the staff on the desk seemed helpful. I had read in a review that rooms at the front of the hotel were noisy, so we asked if it was possible to have a room at the back of the hotel, the receptionist checked and informed us that one was available. On the way to our room we went up the staircase instead of the lift, the stairway was a bit dated and in need of a lick of paint but in the corridors it was nicely decorated and brightly lit. When we got to our room it was lovely and clean and there were no cracks or broken wires as mentioned in other reviews. Although the room lacked air conditioning, the window let in a nice breeze and we weren't disturbed by any exterior noise. The bathroom was ideal, with a full length bath, shower, sink and toilet and although it was clean a few of the tiles seemed in need of a scrub. The shower did cause a slight problem as it was too hot and lowering the temperature caused difficulties, but after a while we figured it out. The location of the hotel was ideal, about a 10 minute walk from both Kings Cross and Farringdon tube stations. With plenty of places to eat and drink in nearby. We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and if I could get another saver rate room I would definately stay in it again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price but not good.”
Reviews.Author: marksmissus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as we had an early Eurostar to catch.We paid Â£29 for the room and for the price it was ok but I would not have been happy if I had paid any more.The double bed was 2 singles pushed together and was reasonably comfy.My main complaint is with the shower-it only had one temperature which was 'scalding hot' making it impossible to shower!! Also the location is not the best and had I been a single woman I would not have felt safe walking to the hotel by myself.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the high tarrif”
Reviews.Author: winter1978
Reviews.Content: A group of us travelled to London for a concert and needed to stay somewhere cheep for the one night, It worked out about Â£25.00 per person for the night so we booked it. Its not the best example of a travelodge, I have stayed in some decent ones but it was only for the one night & we wouldent be staying in all night. The room is awful, really small & bland. The bathroom was old and tired, it had been cleaned but everything was so old it was past the point of cleaning to spruce it up. The beds were really uncomfortable and the room was boiling hot. This was not just my room all in our party (6 rooms) were the same, it needs some investment. I had noticed that the hotel was charging Â£81.00 for the night on a room only basis, this is more then we paid but if I had to pay that we wouldent have stayed. We got a good internet deal and to be fair can not grumble about Â£25.00 per night, but cant get over they were getting Â£81.00 for thier rooms in the condition they were in. Some of us decided to stay an extra night in London, and for an extra Â£25.00 we stayed in the City Inn which was fantastic & stylish & included breakfast - i dont think any of us would have stayed an extra night at the travelodge. Its a bed factory of the worst kind

Reviews.Title: “Too noisey!”
Reviews.Author: DJHAPPYFEET
Reviews.Content: Rooms 521, avoid as it overlooks the very main road and without any double glazing, and with the aid of ear plugs the traffic noise kept us awake all night. No hot water in the shower,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kimr86
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very cheaply priced at Â£29 pn and is perfectly located near Kings Cross station and the town of farrigdon. Rooms were nice - no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad For The Money”
Reviews.Author: ubersiter
Reviews.Content: For Â£50 You Can't Moan..........But I Will Anyway The Shower Didn't Work And There Double Beds Are Just Two Single Beds With a Sheet Covering The Gap. It Was However Clean And tidy The Staff Were Nice And The Lifts Worked. If You Can Try To Get a Room At The Back Of The Hotel. 10 Mins Walk To KingsCross Station.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal at the price central london”
Reviews.Author: JulianandGillian
Reviews.Content: I can't argue with the previous reviews but at Â£29 per room in central London this is a pretty good deal. I've stayed in smaller, noisier rooms in London for a lot more money. The service lift is now available for guests use. Staff were very pleasant. The room was large and clean and as it was at the back wasn't too noisy at all. Expect no frills and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Cheap Cheerful accomodation for London Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Jools1979
Reviews.Content: Just thought I'd do a review of London Farringdon to complete my current tripadvisor repertoire!!:-) Stayed here last summer for some sightseeing and a day at wimbledon championships. Its an ok hotel, room and bathroom nice enough just beware of rooms on the raodside as the traffic around Kings Cross area is relentless all night long and on fridays and saturdays you have noisy drunks yelling shouting their way home all night long too! We didn't get much sleep the three days that we stayed in this room as the traffic was so noisy even with the window shut and this in turn made the room stifling warm. The buffet breakfast thing wasn't the best either so beware of paying Â£8 each in advance for some shrivelled up scrambled egg and beans that have been sat on the side for ages! King's Cross is a bit of a rough area but not that rough really! You don't see many people about at ngiht. Ideal for tube trains! A fantastic indian resyaurant at King's Cross too !!!

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here is you've paid Â£26 / night or less”
Reviews.Author: clarelw
Reviews.Content: We have a trip to London every year in January for my husband's birthday. We always get great rates in the travelodges and pretty much know what to expect. We stayed 11th and 12th Jan for Â£19 per room per night - so a total of Â£38. The hotel itself is a good 20 minute walk from Kings Cross and you do pass a S&M shop and also a massage / sauna place which looked very seedy. This however did not bother us as we had already stayed at the London Kings Cross Royal Scot 2 years previously (which is 5 minutes nearer and nicer). We checked in easily at 2:30pm and were informed that the lifts were not working and to take the stairs. This did make me laugh as I had read before we travelled that they had been broke for several weeks. Luckily we were only on the 2nd floor! The room itself was a bit mismatch. 2 single beds pushed together which although old and slightly lumpy were quite comfortable. The room faced the main road in front and was quite stuffy. This meant that we kept the window open the entire stay and therefore the room was noisey. This might bother you if you are a light sleeper however we did not have any problems sleeping. The bedside table was a good metre from the bed. Only 4 hangers in the wardrobe but plenty of drawers. The room did have a flat screen TV which was nice and had a couple of extra freeview channels. There was also internet access if you needed it. Also tea and coffee making facilities. The bathroom was the worst part. The toilet seat had been taped back together. The bathroom was tiny, I struggled to turn around in it. The shower was old and the shower curtain very smelly. The shower curtain rail was all rusty and there was a lot of mold on the ceiling. I tried to spend as little time as possible in here. The only toiletries you get here are a small bar of soap for washing hands. The bar in the hotel did not open until 5pm and stayed open until at least 12 so forget any ideas of getting lunch. 5 minutes walk away there was a collection of shops, restaurants and pubs and we ate in 2 of the restaurants which were very nice. Rather than getting the tube back into central London we caught the bus (no. 19 or 38 to Leicester Square area) turn left out of the hotel and walk for about 5 minutes. you will come to some traffic lights cross the road and the bus stop is in front of you (area is called Exmouth market) for Â£2 each. Saved the 20 minute walk to and from Kings Cross. Would I stay in this hotel again? Only if it was all I could find and under Â£26 / night however I would try my hardest to find somewhere closer. Do not stay here at the Â£81 / night rate. There are better hotels at this rate. Pay a maximum of Â£26 night.

Reviews.Title: “Not Much Good”
Reviews.Author: spookysee
Reviews.Content: I would have given this hotel a 2 star if only for the 26gbp price for one night I got online six months in advance. However, after arriving from an overnight flight from San Francisco, an hour on the tube, and a 20+ minute walk from Kings Cross/St. Pancras it was disheartening to be told the lift wasn't working and our room was on the 4th floor. (Of course, the guy at the desk said the lift would be fixed "tomorrow" - clearly the lift has been broken for weeks - unbelievable.) The room was big enough and clean enough and even had big, fluffy towels and a tea/coffee pot, though the bed was old and lumpy. And I might have still given two stars if it weren't for being woken up by a fire alarm at 2:30am and then herded outside in the freezing cold for 45 min for what was obviously a false alarm (a card had been jammed in and broken off in the outer door, and the desk clerk and firemen had obviously seen this "prank" before). I was looking for an inexpensive place to rest in London before an early morning train trip to York the next morning out of Kings Cross. Inexpensive - yes. Restful - no. And the Travelodge Royal Scot was closer and without the walk by the s&m shop. As I told my teenage son when he voiced concerns about the area, "One sex shop equals colorful; you have to see two or more to equal seedy." A much better choice is the rather nice Novotel near Kings Cross which I got for 80 bucks on Priceline for our last night. Only 5 mins. walk from the tube and not much more expensive than a crappy, distant, Travelodge that doesn't even bother to fix its lifts for weeks on end.

Reviews.Title: “No working lifts!”
Reviews.Author: Pattty
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for two nights on the fantastic price of Â£19 per night, and because of the price we really couldn't complain! However, on checking in we were told that their lifts were not working, after asking, we found out they had been broken for over a week! We were then told we were on the 4th floor, and with three suitcases (one per room), no porters, we struggled to drag/haul these to our rooms. NOT a good start. However the rooms themselves were clean and the decor was ok. We too had a cracked mirror, which we assumed may have come from the kettle which was next too it. Two of the rooms were at the front of the hotel and the road noise was pretty bad, especially as the windows didn't close completely. The room at the back of the hotel was much better, until the bin men arrived at 8am! This room also had minimal hot water though and no plug. The location was half way between Farringdon Tube and Kings Cross tube, so in future I will first look at cheap rooms at Kings Cross Royal Scot (stayed here before and much nicer). It definitely was a GOOD 10 minute walk to this hotel, but if it comes down to price and availability I would stay here for Â£19 per night! There is also a J D Wetherspoons down the road (5-10 minute walk) for Â£2.49 breakfasts!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: PortsmouthPingPong
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed in the Travelodge in Farringdon, London. My only advice is do not stay there, my 2 nights there have been a nightmare. The lift was not working so we had to drag our luggage up the fire escape stairs, no portarage available. I am visibly impaired and found it very difficult trying to see the steps and carry my luggage, I did ask for a room on the lower levels but trying to get anyone to understand what you are saying is very difficult because quote 'sorry cannot speak english' was branded about at any oportunity if you tried to talk to anyone. Then it became dark, the stairs are badly lit with several light bulbs not working, so you imagine my problems trying to get up and down the stairs. On the second night we arrived back at the hotel in the dark to find the stairs being washed, in the dark, with no thought for guests trying to go up and down the dark stairwell, again no 0one could speak english and there was no manager to talk to. All in all a very disappointing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good at the price - For London”
Reviews.Author: Rick_The_Builder
Reviews.Content: This hotel at this price outside london would be a bad deal, for london its OK. I have stayed in some real dumps in London, and even some of the very expensive hotels come under the above description. The room is clean, but in need of minor maintenance, before it gets worse. Various small faults. The food in the resturant was not good, but this hotel is only 2 minuites walk from an area with a good variety of places to eat. This hotel is not upto the normal travelodge standards, but its london - so you expect that. I'd probably come back.

Reviews.Title: “Karl and Vicky”
Reviews.Author: Karl_Vicky
Reviews.Content: Ok, so its not the most expensive hotel in the world, BUT, it should at least be CLEAN! The room had a burnt lamp shade, rusting shower curtain pole, cracked mirror, cracked wall, "dubious" stains on the bathroom floor, tea stained dressing table (badly stained), and a window that wouldn't seal (meaning shed loads of road noise). The breakfast is a joke at Â£7.50, and we had to get a refund as the sausages would best be described as rocks, there were no plates or glasses, there was no bacon, the egg was more grey than yellow.
